column10: If you need good beach and delicious food must go to hotel hikka trans .
column12:
I recently stayed at Hikka Tranz Hotel, and it was a fantastic experience. The beachfront location is breathtaking, offering stunning views of the ocean and easy access to the beach. The rooms are spacious, well-decorated, and equipped with modern amenities, ensuring a comfortable stay.

The staff were incredibly friendly and attentive, always willing to help with a smile. The dining options were diverse, with delicious meals that showcased local flavors. The hotel also features a lovely pool area, perfect for relaxing after a day of exploring.

column12:
We recently had our wedding, and we couldn’t be happier with how everything turned out. Thilini, our event coordinator, went above and beyond to make our day truly unforgettable. Her attention to detail, dedication, and seamless organisation made everything flow perfectly. From the smallest details to the big moments, everything was exactly as we’d hoped – if not better!

We’re so grateful for all the hard work Thilini put into making our wedding perfect. She was truly amazing, and we couldn’t have done it without her! If you’re looking for someone who’ll make your big day stress-free and magical, we highly recommend Thilini and her team.

Thank you again for everything!
column13: Absolutely Perfect Wedding Thanks to Thilini and the Team!

column5:
{'id': '977109760', 'text': 'Dear Sianna,

Thank you for taking the time to share your review of your stay at Hikka Tranz by Cinnamon. We appreciate your feedback, both positive and negative.

We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay overall and appreciated the beautiful grounds, spacious rooms, and delicious food. We are especially pleased to know that Dinesh provided excellent service and made you feel welcome.

We apologize for the negative experience you had with a few members of our staff. We take guest feedback very seriously and will use this information to improve our training and ensure that all our guests receive a warm and welcoming experience.

We understand your concern regarding the large groups. All our guests are of utmost value to us, and we wish to provide everyone with a safe and comfortable stay with us. We will take all necessary measures to try and to minimize any disruption caused to our patrons.

We hope that despite these minor issues, you were able to enjoy your time in Sri Lanka and at our hotel. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future and provide you with an even better experience.

Sincerely, \xa0 

Indika Dissanayake
Resort Manager', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-10-29', 'responder': 'Guest Service Manager', 'connectionToSubject': 'Guest Services / Front Office'}
column6: {'id': '579245', 'name': 'Hikka Tranz by Cinnamon', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 3665, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.132134, 'longitude': 80.10093, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d579245-Reviews-Hikka_Tranz_by_Cinnamon-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.cinnamonhotels.com/hikkatranzbycinnamon/', 'address': '360 Galle Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '360 Galle Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80240'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 143, 'count2': 133, 'count3': 308, 'count4': 962, 'count5': 2119}}
column12:
Visited in August. 

We booked Hikkatranz as a base and also went travelling around Sri Lanka. 

Firstly, Sri Lanka is a beautiful place. 

First impressions of a few members of staff (a main lady) on the entrance of the restaurant were not great. She was not too welcoming, very dismissive and rude. 

However, as we settled into our trip we enjoyed ourselves. The food was tasty and never repetitive. There was everything from authentic Sri Lanka food, to Russian, English, Asian etc cuisine.  

The grounds are beautiful and well maintained and the rooms are large. Special mention to Dinash, he was our room cleaner. He went the extra mile daily and made us feel welcome during our stay with his daily conversations and smiley face. 

One thing that marred our experience a tiny bit were the big organised groups of men that would embark upon the hotel and fully take over the place, getting drunk, loud and lairy. 

Also, the turtles that swam to the shore line of the beach added to the magic of this holiday. 

All in all, good and I’d highly recommend this hotel.

column12: Hikka Tranz has one of the best corners of the Hikkaduwa beach, which means it has a great view from every room in the hotel, a great view from the restaurant, and a great view from the poolside. The hotel is an old and well known hotel and Cinnamon have done a great job refurbishing the hotel. It meets today's standards but still maintains the unique style and design of hotels past.I also highly recommend the seafood platter when it is offered fresh on the day. And every member of staff were friendly and helpful.
column13: Hikka Tranz is a great experience!

column12: Lovely hotel with a great selection of food. Rooms were very clean and all enjoying sea views. Perfect beachside location for seeing turtles although be prepared for locals pestering you to buy seaweed to feed the turtles. A firm but polite no thank you and keep walking does the trick. Dont get sucked into the line "Where are you from" as soon as you enter a convo you'll be hounded. We were told by one local it was his birthday and wanted us to buy him a beer (at 9.30am) he stood at the exit of the resort to the beach the whole day shouting and waving trying to get our attention, so be warned.  Anybody visiting must try the Crab Shack as the food and service is absolutely fantastic!! We went out of season so nothing much happening but theres so much to see, there's plenty to fill your day. Would definitely stay again if ever back in Hikkaduwa.

column12: was a very pleasant experience. The hotel ambience was very nice. We were pleasantly surprised from the get go as we were given an upgraded room for no additional charge. The view from the balcony was spectacular and the beach was lovely too. The TV had a good selection of channels and the gym was very decent for fitness enthusiasts. The staff was very pleasant and friendly and the overall vibe was very upbeat and great. My little one was given a toy turtle much to her delight. The food was very good, especially the breakfast which we enjoyed a great deal. The lunch room also has a section that is very close to the sea. I thoroughly recommend having a meal or two there as you have the sound of the ocean and fresh sea breeze as you have your meal...very relaxing indeed. A special shout out to Ms. Renuka, Mr. Amarakeerthi and Mr. Yomal from the restaurant and many other staff including the gentleman at the gym who made us feel extremely welcome!

One of the best hotel we have ever stayed on.

Great staff, fantastic pool and a good buffet for the kids. 

The view from the room looking over the ocean was fantastic, and it was possible to see sea turtles at the bay

We will surely come back if we come to Hikkaduwa again.

column12:
We spent two lovely nights in Hikka Trans - the hotel is surrounded by stunning pools and is right on the beach. Every morning and evening you might be lucky enough to see turtles swimming beside you. The staff in this hotel are fantastic and see to your every need - Madashanka cleaned our room and left a vase of beautiful free flowers for us along with our towels decorated into the shapes of bunny rabbits !  A great hotel and amazing location. 
Would definitely recommend

column12:
We had 10 wonderful nights at the resort. Arrived early at 6:00 in the morning but after 20 minutes we had got our room with a wonderful sea view. Would say that all the staff seemed happy and professional and so srviceminded. Specially I would like to highlight the entire pool staff and the entire crew at the beach bar. They had a fantastic collaboration and an eye on every finger. Outstanding. The buffet restaurant was world class - both for breakfast, lunch and dinner. At every meal we were greeted by a smiling Chamila, who could both scold (because I smoked) and smile at the same time.:). But our regular waiter, Nalaka, was just world-class. Great overview, professionalism and made sure every meal was a great experience. 
We will be back for sure

column10: Plenty of sun screen and try the Arrack Cocktails.
column12:
Big thanks to all the Hikka Tranz staff.
Big shout out to Manoj from room  cleaning. His sense of humour and skill in towel origami is only outdone by his professional service.
The Head Chef and Resort Managers are amazing and have gone the extra mile to make us feel extremely welcome and even spoilt. They are supported by all the other Chefs, Cook's, Waiting staff, Kitchen staff, Indoor & Outdoor Bar staff, Security personnel, grounds keepers, and Admin staff. Hoppers are best in Sri Lanka cooked by a very lovely lady.
Rooms are well appointed with good cooling and bathroom facilities. Beds are big and made up every day as well as fresh towels and the room cleaned.
Pool area is beautiful with plenty of towels that can be used at the beach as well. 
The resort is located in a fantastic spot on the corner of the coast with a great swimming beach and another section where turtles come in to eat seaweed. 
A really great place for couples or families to relax at any stage of a Sri Lankan holiday. 
Definitely be back to stay next time and see all the Hikka Tranz Team.

column10: Have fun and enjoy.
column12:
Hikka Tranz is a great hotel in the Southern part of Sri-Lanka in the place Hikkaduwa.
A great hotel with very good and delicious food, different types of food: English breakfast, Rice, Pasta, Fish, Pizza or even local food as chicken masala, chili meat and a lot more.
After that you can pick a lovely dessert made by Senaka chef of the kitchen of the hotel, he is very polite, professionally very good, kindly and really good in his work. Also the rest of the staff are very kindly.
So when you chooses for a holiday in Sri-lanka go to Hikka Tranz by Cinnamon in Hikkaduwa.
Peter Borgmand and Maria Nieuwland

column12: We chose this hotel for our company annual trip and we enjoyed very much along with our families. column12:
I had ouch at Hikka Tranz by Cinnamon in Sri Lanka, I was incredibly impressed by the exceptional service provided by the bell desk team. From the moment I arrived, they were attentive, professional, and always ready to assist with a smile. Whether it was handling my luggage swiftly, providing local insights, or coordinating transport, their efficiency stood out.

What really made the experience special was their genuine warmth and hospitality. remembered my preferences, and made sure I felt well taken care of throughout my lunch. Also main restaurant & team had superb knowledge on what I was asking offering great recommendations on local attractions and helping with transportation arrangements.

Even in moments of high activity, the team remained calm, courteous, and attentive to every to every individual. The level of dedication they showed reflected the hotel’s commitment to quality service. 

Thanks to the bell desk staff & the restaurant staff, my lunch was smooth, enjoyable, and hassle-free. It’s rare to find such a blend of professionalism and friendliness, and I would highly recommend Hikka Tranz by Cinnamon for this reason. They truly made my experience memorable and contributed to the overall excellence of the hotel.

column5:
{'id': '967510542', 'text': 'Dear Guest,

Greetings From Hikka Tranz by Cinnamon!🌊🐢

Thank you for taking the time to share your review of your stay at our hotel. We appreciate your feedback as it helps us improve our services.

Regarding the additional 20% charge you mentioned, we would like to clarify that this consists of two mandatory taxes imposed by the Sri Lankan government: Value Added Tax (VAT) of 18% & a Special Consumption Levy (SSCL) of 2% tax.
We understand that these taxes can sometimes be unexpected, but they are legally required by the government. We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused.

We are glad to hear that you enjoyed the food, staff, and location. We will continue to strive to provide excellent service to all of our guests.

Thank you again for your feedback.

Sincerely,
Indika Dissanayake
Resort Manager', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-08-30', 'responder': 'Guest Service Manager', 'connectionToSubject': 'Guest Services / Front Office'}

column10: Not much shade in the pool
column12:
Wasn’t worth the money overall
We booked online only to find we had to pay an extra 20% in taxes when we checked in
Overall hotel is ok, food is excellent, staff really helpful. Sampath at concierge desk was very good.
Great location to beach!!
However Rooms were basic and bathrooms not that nice, very small and cramped, black mould on lower tiles and frayed/torn bathmats
A nice hotel, would stay again but not at the price we paid, I don’t think it’s worth more than 100usd a night given the bathroom and room quality
column13: Nice hotel depending on what you pay !

column10: Only positive things to say. Staff were fabulous and in particular Chamilla who is front of house in the restaurant.
column12:
An excellent stay at a venue that has it all. Large rooms, great facilities, breakfast, lunch and dinner buffets were fabulous. 

Front of restaurant staff member Camilla, is a great ambassador for the hotel. I found her to be very engaging following a number of conversations, friendly and with the most beautiful smile. 

I highly recommend this venue for your stay.

column5:
{'id': '967511688', 'text': "Dear Seymour,

Thank you for taking the time to share your wonderful review of your stay at our hotel. We are delighted to hear that you and your family had such a memorable experience.

We are particularly pleased to know that you appreciated the excellent work of Dilakshi. Our team strives to provide a seamless experience for all of our guests, and it's gratifying to know that we achieved that for you.

We are also thrilled to hear that our baby pool was a hit with your little ones. Providing a safe and enjoyable space for families with children is important to us, and we're glad that your family enjoyed it.

Your positive feedback about our buffet restaurant and housekeeping service is further confirmation that we are meeting our guests' expectations. We are committed to offering a high standard of service in all areas of our hotel.

We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you and your family back to our hotel in the future.

Sincerely,
Indika Dissanayake

column6: {'id': '579245', 'name': 'Hikka Tranz by Cinnamon', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 3665, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.132134, 'longitude': 80.10093, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d579245-Reviews-Hikka_Tranz_by_Cinnamon-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.cinnamonhotels.com/hikkatranzbycinnamon/', 'address': '360 Galle Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '360 Galle Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80240'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 143, 'count2': 133, 'count3': 308, 'count4': 962, 'count5': 2119}}
column12:
We had a wonderful stay with our families for 3 days.
The check - in&out process is faster and better than most hotels in SriLanka. The credit goes to the front office Ms. Dilaikshi who handled our check in and payment in an incredibly efficient manner and being very helpful and attentive.
The baby pool must be the winner, our little buddies had a great time in there.
For the buffet restaurant : of course, nothing to complain, both western and local cuisines available with a great deal of varieties.
The rooms: after stayed in most start rank hotels in SriLanka, this hotel rooms and housekeeping service is far beyond the average.

Overall, it was a wonderful stay, would visit again with our families.
column13: Had a great time with our families

column12: The hotel was very clean and the food was very tasty also. The bedroom was neat and tidy. The swimming pool was also very clean. The view of the beach is very beautiful. The beach is also very clean. The customer service was also excellent. The staff is also good.
column13: The hotel is very clean and the food was very tasty.

column6: {'id': '2456385', 'name': 'Roman Beach', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 383, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.12214, 'longitude': 80.11299, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d2456385-Reviews-Roman_Beach-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://romanbeach.lk', 'address': '777/2 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '777/2 Galle Road', 'street2': 'Thiranagama', 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80240'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 55, 'count5': 312}}
column12:
This hotel was our first stop in Sri Lanka to get acclimated to the weather and the time difference and we couldn’t have picked a better hotel. What stood out most was the size of the rooms, the cleanliness of the premises (thanks to Akalanka, Deep and Sugath), and the devotion of the employees, especially Ravidu and Surangi! Everyone was welcoming and extremely helpful. They didn’t hesitate to give good recommendations of what to do or where to go, like the nice receptionist and the kind manager. 

The food was another highlight of this hotel that everyone should experience! It was simply amazing and they were very accommodating of any special requests we had in this regard. We recommend this hotel to everyone who comes to Sri Lanka and wants to experience Hikkaduwa.
column13: A great way to experience Hikkaduwa!

column6: {'id': '2456385', 'name': 'Roman Beach', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 383, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.12214, 'longitude': 80.11299, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d2456385-Reviews-Roman_Beach-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://romanbeach.lk', 'address': '777/2 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '777/2 Galle Road', 'street2': 'Thiranagama', 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80240'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 55, 'count5': 312}}
column12:
We had a very nice and personal stay at the Roman Beach Hotel. The small-scale hotel is located in the lee of the main road. The friendly staff likes to make guests feel at home whenever possible. Fresh fruit juice on arrival as a welcome drink. 
In the room, with sea view, everything is there. Space for the suitcase, tea and coffee making facilities, minibar, safe etc. The towels decorated in a special way. 
The chef, Supun, comes to ask about your wishes. As a vegetarian, I can really appreciate that. A man with a lot of experience! The pool is lovingly maintained daily by Sugath. He takes care of the garden and is ready with the pool towels as soon as you want to lie down.
Varna, the manager is very friendly and willing to have a chat and think along with you.

column12:
Very beautiful and peaceful hotel I stay one night Room is super front of the beach people are very good . breakfast dinner very good .
All the staff are very professional and they know how to treat guest I will definitely come again this hotel thanks

column6: {'id': '2456385', 'name': 'Roman Beach', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 383, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.12214, 'longitude': 80.11299, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d2456385-Reviews-Roman_Beach-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://romanbeach.lk', 'address': '777/2 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '777/2 Galle Road', 'street2': 'Thiranagama', 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80240'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 55, 'count5': 312}}
column12:
After our round trip through Sri Lanka, we spent 10 wonderful days at Roman Beach. 

The stay was very special right from the start. Within a very short time we felt like we are staying with friends. 
All the staff, from the "pool boy" Sugath, to the waiter Ravindu and his colleagues, to the manager Warna... everyone was just fantastic! 
The meals which were prepared in the kitchen were excellent! 

The entire complex and the rooms are very well maintained. The location on the quiet stretch of beach is also worth mentioning.

It was very difficult for us to say goodbye. It had been an honor to spend wonderful days here.

column6: {'id': '2456385', 'name': 'Roman Beach', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 383, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.12214, 'longitude': 80.11299, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d2456385-Reviews-Roman_Beach-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://romanbeach.lk', 'address': '777/2 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '777/2 Galle Road', 'street2': 'Thiranagama', 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80240'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 55, 'count5': 312}}
column12:
We stayed for 4 nights at Roman Beach Hotel. The stay was wonderful everything was great, there was nothing we did not like. The food was so delicious, absolutley amazing. The Waiter Bhagya was extremly nice and friendly, he was so helpful and recommend us some dishes to try which we really liked. The pool and garden was so clean and very charming, the gardener „Sugar“ was always smilling and bringig us flower which felt down he even asked us if we want to drink something and recommend us passion fruit juice.
The room was also very nice and the bed comfortable. The hotel is located at a calm place of Hikaduwa. 
Staff, hotel and food were perfect - we can absolutley recolmend staying there.

column5:
{'id': '963579249', 'text': 'Thank you for your kind review! We’re delighted to hear that Warna, Sampath, Kalani, and Sugath made your stay so enjoyable. It’s great to know you appreciated the food and the effort our Chef put into preparing it. We look forward to welcoming you back to Roman Beach!

Best regards,
The Roman Beach Team

column12: We had a very pleasant experience. Warna and Sampath went out of their way to make our stay comfortable. Kalani at the Front office was also very efficient and helpful. Sugath too was very attentive to all our needs. We found the food, which the Chef had gone to great lengths to prepare, was to our taste and very well presented. Looking to coming again.
column13: A very pleasant stay at Roman Beach,  Hikkaduwa

column6: {'id': '2456385', 'name': 'Roman Beach', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 383, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.12214, 'longitude': 80.11299, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d2456385-Reviews-Roman_Beach-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://romanbeach.lk', 'address': '777/2 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '777/2 Galle Road', 'street2': 'Thiranagama', 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80240'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 55, 'count5': 312}}
column12:
Our stay at Roman Beach Hotel was wonderful! We were treated like kings and queens. The location is very beautiful and the view from the room is amazing. The pool and the surrounding area was always clean. Thanks to Sugat, who does a perfect job! All the staff is very friendly and fullfilled all our wishes. 
Roman Beach Hotel has the best Chef ever. The food was delicious. The special dinner at the beach is unforgettable. Children are very well treated and welcome. Thanks to all!
I recommand to stay here!
column13: Perfect stay in an amazing place!

column6: {'id': '2456385', 'name': 'Roman Beach', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 383, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.12214, 'longitude': 80.11299, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d2456385-Reviews-Roman_Beach-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://romanbeach.lk', 'address': '777/2 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '777/2 Galle Road', 'street2': 'Thiranagama', 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80240'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 55, 'count5': 312}}
column10: The sunset at the beach looks phenomenal.
column12: At this place literally everything was perfect. The Staff was so kind and always made our wishes come true. They treated us very good. The Owner of the hotel is named Sugath, he made the garden and the pool everyday. Also the cook was very nice to us and made delicious food, for example hoppers. The room was also very clean and good. At our last day we had dinner at the beach it was so beautiful with the sunset and the waves and everything. This hotel was a 10/10 experience and im sure its the best hotel near this area for its price.

column6: {'id': '2456385', 'name': 'Roman Beach', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 383, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.12214, 'longitude': 80.11299, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d2456385-Reviews-Roman_Beach-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://romanbeach.lk', 'address': '777/2 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '777/2 Galle Road', 'street2': 'Thiranagama', 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80240'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 55, 'count5': 312}}
column12:
We absolutely loved this hotel from start to finish. 
We had a beautiful room with sea view, the pool was fantastic, the food was the best we've eaten in Sri Lanka, but what made it for us were the staff here were just outstanding. Each and every member of the team worked so hard to make their guests happy. They greeted us with smiles, were helpful and so very friendly. The manager Warna is wonderful, couldn't do enough and we loved our chats with him. Sugath's smiles around the pool, attentive at every moment to us and kind to our daughter, getting drinks, towels and balls for the pool (he even cleaned our tuk tuk rental for us!) Sampath was courteous at meal times, explaining the different dishes and Kalani made us welcome from the start as did all the staff here who helped with our bags and kept our room wonderfully clean, I wish I could name each individually as they all deserve a mention! 

We ate at the hotel as the chef took the time to talk with the guests and he put my mind at rest that he would serve Sri Lankan food that wasn't too spicy for us. The food was wonderful! It was a pleasure to stay and eat here. 
Overall, with only 6 rooms the hotel feels peaceful, it's quiet around the pool and beach, but it's not too far from the main town for the restaurants and shops. Pool is perfect with shady spots during the heat of the day, plenty of sun loungers and right on the beautiful beach. Rooms were bright and spacious with great air con comfy beds and a huge bathroom and balcony. We couldn't have wanted for more. 

Thanks to all of you for making the last 3 nights of our holiday very memorable! 

I hope we can return to Hikkaduwa and Roman Beach Hotel.

column6: {'id': '2456385', 'name': 'Roman Beach', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 383, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.12214, 'longitude': 80.11299, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d2456385-Reviews-Roman_Beach-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://romanbeach.lk', 'address': '777/2 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '777/2 Galle Road', 'street2': 'Thiranagama', 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80240'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 55, 'count5': 312}}
column12:
Great hospitality...attentive and smiling staff, special mention of Silva who served us diligently , says has a motto of Happy Guests..Happy us.
 Beautiful private beach access, delectable set menus, and most importantly "How can I help" attitude of the whole staff. 
Loved every moment of it. 
Just a recommendation to improve their bar.

column6: {'id': '2456385', 'name': 'Roman Beach', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 383, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.12214, 'longitude': 80.11299, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d2456385-Reviews-Roman_Beach-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://romanbeach.lk', 'address': '777/2 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '777/2 Galle Road', 'street2': 'Thiranagama', 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80240'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 55, 'count5': 312}}
column12:
My family and I stayed at Roman Beach for the month of February. Having been to Sri Lanka many times, this was the first time we had stayed at a boutique hotel.

The location of the hotel is perfect if you want to be on a quieter side of Hikkaduwa, slightly away from the crowds but only a short walk from the bars/ restaurants and shops. It feels very private. 

The decor is beautiful throughout the hotel with gorgeous furnishings, all creating a very cosy, relaxing vibe. The rooms are spacious and bright with an amazing-sized balcony, all with an outstanding sea view. 

The beds are super comfortable and all the room amenities make it feel extra special. The hotel has a high level of cleanliness throughout and the housekeeping staff do an excellent job in the rooms. Attention to detail is superb in all areas. 

 The pool is very well maintained and provided lots of fun for my baby boy. The pool staff, especially Sugath do an excellent job. My baby is still asking for him. His kindness will not be forgotten. Every staff member went above and beyond to make our stay feel extra special. Warune the manager was very attentive, he would go out of his way every day to make sure my family was comfortable. Supan the chef is very talented at what he does. We ate the best food we have ever tasted in Sri Lanka. We recommend the Sri Lankan Curry as it’s absolutely delicious! The restaurant staff were all excellent and again my baby will miss Bhagya, Udshion and Akalanka. Kelanee on reception is very polite and caring. Christi is also a lovely man, we can’t thank him enough for his kindness. The hotel really does have a nice atmosphere and I believe the staff are to thank for this. 

If you are looking for a warm welcome and want to be made to feel like family, do not hesitate to book Roman Beach. You will not be disappointed. We will certainly be back!
column13: A very special stay at Roman Beach

column6: {'id': '2456385', 'name': 'Roman Beach', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 383, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.12214, 'longitude': 80.11299, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d2456385-Reviews-Roman_Beach-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://romanbeach.lk', 'address': '777/2 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '777/2 Galle Road', 'street2': 'Thiranagama', 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80240'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 55, 'count5': 312}}
column12: If you are looking for a quiet memorable holiday with good food, pristine beach, then this is the place!! Excellent location, it's located 2 minutes from the sea with quality food & attentive staff. Very clean hotel, Varun manager, chef, restaurant staff & the cleaner Sugath are doing a great job. We had personalised attention all the time.

column6: {'id': '2456385', 'name': 'Roman Beach', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 383, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.12214, 'longitude': 80.11299, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d2456385-Reviews-Roman_Beach-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://romanbeach.lk', 'address': '777/2 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '777/2 Galle Road', 'street2': 'Thiranagama', 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80240'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 55, 'count5': 312}}
column12: A small boutique hotel with lots of personal attention. The staff is very warm and welcoming. A great place to stay with your family. Sugath the pool guy is very hospitable. The manager is thoughtful and they have a great cook! We had a great night with dinner near the beach and a great bonfire.

column6: {'id': '2456385', 'name': 'Roman Beach', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 383, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.12214, 'longitude': 80.11299, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d2456385-Reviews-Roman_Beach-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://romanbeach.lk', 'address': '777/2 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '777/2 Galle Road', 'street2': 'Thiranagama', 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80240'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 55, 'count5': 312}}
column12:
What a gem on the beach! After four very busy days in Sri Lanka we enjoyed such a peaceful stay. Perfect location, huge rooms with terraces  facing the ocean and wonderful staff made our stay unforgettable. 
We highly recommend this place and definitely would stay there in the future.

column6: {'id': '2456385', 'name': 'Roman Beach', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 383, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.12214, 'longitude': 80.11299, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d2456385-Reviews-Roman_Beach-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://romanbeach.lk', 'address': '777/2 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '777/2 Galle Road', 'street2': 'Thiranagama', 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80240'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 55, 'count5': 312}}
column10: Ask Waruna for tours, always worthwhile.
column12: Our stay at Roman Beach Hotel was extraordinary. The hotel is located perfectly, close to everything yet away from the crowds. Beautiful sea view from the room as well as the dining and lounging areas. A big thank you to Waruna for making us feel so at home and organising our beautiful and memorable day trips and tours. Thank you Sugath for taking care of us at the beach and the beautifully maintained pool. Thank you to Bhagya for always taking care of us and making sure we were always comfortable and satisfied with the biggest smile on your face. Thank you to all the friendly and helpful staff that made our trip so enjoyable. We highly recommend and hope to stay here again!

column6: {'id': '2456385', 'name': 'Roman Beach', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 383, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.12214, 'longitude': 80.11299, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d2456385-Reviews-Roman_Beach-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://romanbeach.lk', 'address': '777/2 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '777/2 Galle Road', 'street2': 'Thiranagama', 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80240'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 55, 'count5': 312}}
column12: Roman Beach enjoys a great location with direct access onto the beach, spacious rooms with balconies facing the sea, and friendly, helpful staff. After touring around Sri Lanka we spent a very pleasant few days just relaxing and soaking up the winter sunshine.

column6: {'id': '2456385', 'name': 'Roman Beach', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 383, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.12214, 'longitude': 80.11299, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d2456385-Reviews-Roman_Beach-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://romanbeach.lk', 'address': '777/2 Galle Road Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '777/2 Galle Road', 'street2': 'Thiranagama', 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80240'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 55, 'count5': 312}}
column12:
I stayed one night at the Roman Beach Hotel and it was just great.

The staff were very friendly and helpful. I was also very happy with my room; the high level of cleanliness, the beautiful furnishings as well as the slightly higher room height than usual, create a great atmosphere. As for the location, this is the place to be if you want it quiet and cozy. I enjoyed the Sri Lankan food at the hotel for dinner and breakfast - it was delicious.

I can only recommend this hotel and if I am in Hikkaduwa again, I will definitely stay there again.

column10: We travelled by train and the hotel is not too far from station.
column12: We went to celebrate my birthday at citrust and it was the best. We enjoyed our stay there. Mr.Dhamika gave us an amazing room and the arrangements were nice. The cake which they gave was soo good. The room was clean. The food was so tasty at the buffet and even the food we ordered from the menu. Portion was also good. Prices are reasonable. Not expensive like other places. Loved the view from our room. The staff were friendly with us. This is our 2nd time and we will visit again for sure.

column6: {'id': '609883', 'name': 'Citrus Hikkaduwa', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 1862, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.129539, 'longitude': 80.103065, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d609883-Reviews-Citrus_Hikkaduwa-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://citrusleisure.com/hikkaduwa/', 'address': '400 Galle Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '400 Galle Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80240'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 124, 'count2': 103, 'count3': 243, 'count4': 473, 'count5': 919}}
column12: "My stay at citrus hikkaduwa was absolutely wonderful. The rooms were spacious and clean, the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, and the amenities exceeded my expectations. The hotel's location is perfect for exploring the city, and the  breakfast was a great start to each day. I highly recommend citrus hikkaduwa for anyone looking for a comfortable and enjoyable stay and i would like to thanks for front desk staff really helpful. Thanks for the service once again.

column6: {'id': '609883', 'name': 'Citrus Hikkaduwa', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 1862, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.129539, 'longitude': 80.103065, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d609883-Reviews-Citrus_Hikkaduwa-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://citrusleisure.com/hikkaduwa/', 'address': '400 Galle Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '400 Galle Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80240'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 124, 'count2': 103, 'count3': 243, 'count4': 473, 'count5': 919}}
column10:
Go on a 3 day 2 night tour well worth it
Use the tuktuk transport fun and cheap.
column12: We have spent 2 weeks at this hotel and I can honestly say we had a lovely time. The hotel is very clean and the staff make you feel really welcome. I probably would rate this hotel a good 3 star not 4 as advertised. It is on the beach but on a coral reef so pool shoes advised. My only few bad comment would be the food is not hot and lots of chipped glasses and crockery which need replacing. I would also like to thank Nuan and Chinthaka in the restaurant for making us really welcome and looked after. A big shout out to Roger who runs karaoke on Wednesday and Thursday nights too he even managed to get my husband up to sing. Overall the staff make this hotel a good place to stay.

column6: {'id': '609883', 'name': 'Citrus Hikkaduwa', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 1862, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.129539, 'longitude': 80.103065, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d609883-Reviews-Citrus_Hikkaduwa-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://citrusleisure.com/hikkaduwa/', 'address': '400 Galle Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '400 Galle Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80240'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 124, 'count2': 103, 'count3': 243, 'count4': 473, 'count5': 919}}
column10: We did a 3 day 2 night trip to the elephants,tea factories,Botanical gardens and alot more….Highly recommended
column12: We are just on the last day of a fortnight here in wonderful Sri Lanka.The hotel is spotless with extremely friendly staff.Rooms cleaned daily also clean towels everyday.Mahinda the man who cleans the rooms is  very friendly and left us things on the bed made from towels which we found a nice touch.The hotel is big but certainly not understaffed and each member greeted you with a friendly smile.Aircon in the rooms is great after a warm day in the sun.The restaurant is a good size with plenty of variety unfortunately the food isnt always hot and only lukew warm which needs addressing. We had two regular waiters on opposite shifts who looked after us tremendously and a big shout out to both of them (Nuan and Chinthaka) thankyou both so much.we found the Sri Lankan hotel customers quite rude at times and needed telling so which we did but prepare yourselves for the Russians….WOW a complete embarrassment to their country.I have never in my 56 years on this planet known such bad mannered greedy people in my whole life.Pushy and arrogant and i for one wouldn’t give them the time of day.I had to be restrained by my wife at somepoints before i did something regrettable.Big Shout out also to Roger the resident DJ who was great at his job and got everyone up singing on karaoke including me😁.Would i return to Sri Lanka yes i would and would i return to the Citrus definitely if it was Russian free.

column6: {'id': '609883', 'name': 'Citrus Hikkaduwa', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 1862, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.129539, 'longitude': 80.103065, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d609883-Reviews-Citrus_Hikkaduwa-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://citrusleisure.com/hikkaduwa/', 'address': '400 Galle Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '400 Galle Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80240'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 124, 'count2': 103, 'count3': 243, 'count4': 473, 'count5': 919}}
column12: It is a good hotel, which located in Hikkaduwa area. It also has a stunning view of the sea. I had a one-night stay with my wife. The sunset in the evening was stunning, and the balcony of my room provided a wonderful view. The rooms are clean, but they are not excellent. Morning breakfast buffet was good. There is a plethora of food options to choose from. In general, this is an excellent destination for a vacation.

column10: Top floor room gives a fantastic sea view
column12:
We booked with Mercury Holidays and I have had a great service in the UK and from the two resort reps Ananda and Dexter. 
We booked  the Ella trip with the train ride which I can highly recommend, we loved the trip. Our guide Sanka was wonderful I recommended you request Sanka. 
Well done Mercury I’m impressed. 

We arrived after a 7 hour delay in Abu Dhabi and on arrival the reception staff were welcoming and very efficient 

The room was large with the best sea view ever.
The maid was the best. Everyday the room was spotless and he  made little bed decorations, towels  were changed everyday,  excellent job. 

The waiters and bar staff are good and the food was satisfactory. 

I loved the pool Aqua and found it was a very good workout. 

The two pool attenders gave a 7 star service in all the hotels I have ever stayed this was the best. The moment I arrived at the pool a sun bed was selected and the towel laid out for me. The two pools guys deserve a pay rise.

We used the Spa and can highly recommend it. Really good massage. 

Roger, did karaoke/ DJ  evenings we really enjoyed, everyone  got involved on these nights , they were great fun.
 Loved the live music in the evening, 

The beach is lovely golden sand and it’s a very short walk to an area where you can swim safely and it’s  here that you can feed the turtles, amazing 

Overall fantastic value for money 
Sri Lanka is beautiful the people are lovely and the country has lots to offer.

The rooms were clean and nice. The arrangement was good. Food were amazing. Though we only had breakfast there, the buffet was rich and fabulous. The environment is calm and peaceful. We loved the beach. We loved our vacation on Citrus, hikkaduwa. Cheers.

column10: Treat people how you want to be treated
column12: Was unsure when we arrived as on main road and thought it would be noisy and it was not.  Staff were lovely, nice refreshing drink while filling forms in.  Asked for top floor which we got  and room was great and very clean.  The public areas were lovely and nothing too much trouble for the staff. We were bed and breakfast and there was always plenty to eat and variety we did have some lunches from the bar too.  We both had treatments from the spa and for hotel prices it was very good and the lady was lovely.  Hotel is well placed but preferred going right out of hotel to restaurants and bars. There is a supermarket opp where some people brought bottles of drink and left them and rubbish around the pool are and were demanding of the staff. (there is a war goin on in there country) Seeing the turtles in the shallow water was really nice but go early as later on lots of pushing and shoving on who’s getting the closest or the best picture. We took a tuktuk from outside the hotel turtle hatchery Urawatteseaturtle on galle road and we let go of some tiny little hatchlings we gave a donation to do this. We booked our main trip with our holiday company as we had heard you could be stuck with east euros who are loud abusive if we had booked outside, as they can cram you in so there was only 4 x of us and our drivers were good drivers and very knowledgable the trip was to Udawalawe national park. It was raining but that didn’t matter as we all thought it was fantastic a great day early start though but to go thru the towns and just see people were goin about there day we did have enough time on way back to go to Galle fort and have a quick walk round we even saw the man who dives into the water from the fort.  We are coming back to Scrilanka in November again and staying at the sister hotel Citrus Waskaduwa.

column12:
Not worth the money spent. We checked in for lunch, and there was already a big crowd. By that time, only steamed rice and Mexican rice were available as main dishes. The staff just wiped a table and gave it to us to sit at, without providing proper cutlery.

Dinner was the same. It seemed they had accepted too many bookings. There wasn’t enough space for in-house guests. We had to wait outside until some people finished their dinner and left. Just like lunch, there was no proper cutlery, and the tables were not cleaned properly. The same dessert items were available for both lunch and dinner. The meal plan was poor. Even at breakfast, they served the same fruits: watermelon, papaya, and browned bananas. Overall, not happy.

column10: Go for top floor rooms...
column12:
Our experience during the August school holidays was truly enjoyable.

The check-in procedure was efficient, and we extend our gratitude to Pubudu, Damith, Sandun, Nadun, and the front office staff for their attentiveness to our needs.

Damith was exceptionally accommodating and played a significant role in making our stay memorable.

The children thoroughly delighted in their time at the beach and basking in the sun. 

The main aim of our holiday was to relax and enjoy the sun and the ocean.

Both the food and service were outstanding. We would like to express our sincere appreciation to Chef Roshan and his team (Nilanka, Thilina, Nandana, Nuwan, Chinthaka, Kaushalya, and Sahan).

We eagerly anticipate our next visit!
DH

column10: Don’t go
column12: Myself and a group of 3 friends visited Citrus’ restaurant during our stay in Hikkaduwa of a Saturday evening. The food wasn’t great but our “terrible” review comes from our mistreatment. The service was dreadful, taking over and hour to receive a brownie (which was very similar to a supermarket brownie in the UK), my friend didn’t receive cutlery before her food (a bolognese) was cold (despite many requests) and the mojitos were essentially minty water. We had a very slow waiter who seemed to be unsure of his job and asked us many times what our order was despite writing it down the first time. On completing our food, we simply requested to not pay the service charge or have a slight discount as the service was so poor. The waiter then asked another waiter who, upon hearing our complaint, said it wasn’t his fault as it was busy (the restaurant was not near full) and we should go elsewhere next time if we were so unhappy. Obviously, we then asked for a manager. After telling him the story and saying what this waiter had just said he called the waiter over and asked if this was true, he said not and the manager accused us of lying. He also stated that we couldn’t have any money off as we had consumed the food and not made any complaints. When rebutting the fact we had not complained he stated that due to US not asking for the manager earlier, the whole situation was our fault. We argued this was clearly not good hospitality he became more aggressive and frustrated with us. He then went away and sent over a female employee who upon asking turned out to be an assistant, likely sent over to pacify us with a female approach - we simply asked for the manager back. Eventually, he shouted that if we wanted money off it would come from the waiters salary, which we said would be his choice and that we were happy to take the discount - especially having been there so long and it now being quite a scene. We then waited for a card reader to pay but instead a group of several male workers arrived with an older male at the center claiming to be the manager himself. He acted in a very aggressive and demeaning manner, making us feel quite unsafe and said that we couldn’t have the discount promised just minutes earlier. We did then complain to him but began to feel as though we were being threatened with an ultimatum and he gave the impression he would be ready to hit us. For our safety we then paid and left, feeling as though had we not do so things could have been very bad. Most frustratingly we all felt had we had a male friend with us we may have not been treated with such disrespect and lack of dignity. This ruined one of my friends’ last nights in Sri Lanka! Do not come here !!!
column13: UNSAFE place to eat ! Do not come here! Any complaints will be met with blame and aggressive conduct!

column10: Top floor rooms have best views of ocean. Go check out the turtles five minutes walk on turtle beach ,they are amazing.
column12: We recently returned from a 3 week holiday to the Citrus Hikkaduwa. This hotel is on a busy road but once inside the hotel it is fabulous. The views from most rooms are amazing ,the only noise you can hear is the waves crashing onto the the coral reef. We booked half board and the food was always fresh .hot and tasty. The chefs are always out checking that everything is topped up so nothing is ever left empty. The staff hear are just the best. All of the staff including gardeners , security etc will give you a bit Sri Lankan smile and always want to make your day special. The reception team especially Jayaru the fabulous customer relations young lady was amazing and is a credit to the hotel. A big thank you too for the help and support from Pubuda and Mr Desiva for our general welfare during our stay. They checked up on us every day to make sure that we had no problems or concerns. There is very few hotels in the world that try so hard to make your stay as pleasant as possible. The hotel has many shops and bars close by with no hard sale from staff. The area around has every thing needed. The town Hikkaduwa is not massive and not silly busy. great shops .lovely stretches of beach and lovely friendly locals always wanting to chat. People have complained about the gap year students coming to the hotel . They are great kids, doing brilliant unpaid help in Sri Lanka and they deserve a few hours fun on there afternoons of They never caused any problems and actually made the hotel buzz . The people complaining in my opinion are out of order having fun is not a crime. Please do not stop coming to this beautiful hotel because of a few people who want hotels to be like libraries. We have promised the staff that we will be back to stay again and we will definitely keep our promise. Try it for your selves and hope you have a wonderful stay like our 3 weeks. A big Thank you to all of the wonderful staff  and management that contributed  to making our stay so brilliant and memorable and we will see you all again .
column13: wonderful small piece of Sri Lanka

column12:
I feel really bad for writing a negative review, but the experience was so bad that it feel it is necessary. 

We came to Citrus hotel for dinner in their dining area, expecting average food and service for the rating that the hotel has. We were greeted by a young waitress who seemed inexperienced and didn’t know how to speak English, as we waited 20 mins to get the menu. In an almost empty dining area, we waited for our food for about 35 mins (bearing in mind we are already here for over an hour), got half of our main courses and 10 minutes after our meal we got our drinks. My friend waited an additional 30 minutes for her meal after we got ours (she just ordered a portion of fries). 

All in all, the experience was not a decent one, especially since half of the people were vegetarian and asked for vegetarian meals to which they only informed us half an hour later that they don’t have (they had at least 4 vegetarian options on the menu). A disappointing evening and I feel wrong for spending our last night here.
column13: A disappointing evening with bad service

column10:
No baby pool 
Elevator not provided for Some rooms 
No verity of meals , deserts
first aid box (some essential medicines not available)
column12:
My annual office trip took me to a hotel in Hikkaduwa, a popular tourist destination in Sri Lanka. Since it was a Saturday, a local holiday, the hotel was bustling with guests, both local and foreign. This large crowd might have overwhelmed the staff, as the restaurant was constantly packed, making it difficult to even get a glass of water.
Despite the crowded atmosphere, the room itself was comfortable and cozy, albeit lacking an elevator, which could be a concern for some guests. The staff, however, were friendly and helpful.
One unsettling aspect of the stay was the presence of stray cats wandering around the restaurant area, seemingly ignored by the staff. Additionally, a crow managed to enter the restaurant and snatch food from a plate. These hygiene concerns detracted from the overall experience.
While the hotel's location and room comfort were positive aspects, the overcrowded atmosphere, limited service, and hygiene issues require improvement.
Things to improve 
Reception staff who work at night need some training

column10: Ask for higher floor rooms. The lift to the rooms are in one corner of teh hotel and you might experience a few delays.
column12:
Really good hotel right on the beach.

Even though we reached the hotel late after travelling the entire day from Ella but the smiles on the front office staff put all our tiredness to rest. Check-in was breeze - Thanks to ever-smiling Naomi at the reception - gave us 3 adjoining rooms with amazing sea view. 

Loved the pool. The Pool time is 7:30 to 7:30 however must thank the staff who, upon enquiring, was willing to open the pool even after 7:30pm - very accommodating staff. 

Though the entrance t o the room is facing the road but once you are inside the room - the sea view is mesmerizing.

The Resturant and the bar on the beach has good vibes and the staff is really helpful., they suggested some local brew and I was surprised how good they tasted.

For the breakfast - The Resturant has limited options, apart from Sri Lankan breakfast. I would be nice if they can add a few dishes to the breakfast.

It's a pity we did not get the time to enjoy the hotel facilities - but I will surely stay for a longer period next time.

Overall a good experience.
column13: Good hotel - right at the beach

column12:
This hotel is in a nice beachfront location. I would say it is an average hotel which could be better with a facelift.
Our room was clean and bed very comfortable.
The AC in the room was very noisy as was the road noise which started early in the morning.
The food was good in my opinion and the biggest compliment to this hotel is the staff. All of which were friendly and are an asset.
My main problem with this hotel is the managers idea to allow gap year students in to use the facilities. Pool and sunbeds and towels. 
Generally taking over all areas and not spending any money buying food or drink. 
The hotel is not looking after the paying guests but letting them take all of the sunbeds and towels provided.
Well out of order. 
My second time in Lanka. 
I will return but not to this hotel.

column10: Stay at a different hotel
column12:
It is very rare that I have to log a full complaint about the standard of a hotel. We are very accepting of most things and tolerate a lot.

However, with regret we feel we have no choice but to take this matter further. 

Before I go on, both the hotel and Mercury Holidays are fully aware of our problems and despite being asked to sort them on numerous occasions, they have done NOTHING to help, even when I gave them a very cheap solution.  

Mold in the shower
Mould in the bathroom
Mould around the aircon, very dangerous
General Mould in other areas of the hotel
Cracked tiles around the pool
Dirty pool towels
Plaster/render coming off walls
And so it goes on.

The hotel also allows non paying guests, mainly gap year students, to come into the hotel and use the sunbeds and facilities. The theory is they buy food and drink in return, but they don't. They just make it almost impossible for paying guests to get sunbeds. We also have to put up with screeching and giggling constantly. As one guest said, it's like we are part of a university campus. Even the students say they can't believe they can use the facilities for free.

But that all pails into insignificance when it comes to Wednesday and Thursday night. A night billed as Karaoke entertainment for the hotel guests. But that's not the case. Wednesday and Thursday nights are when over 100 of the students descend on the hotel. They get drunk, jump in the pool in their underwear (mainly girls), and then run through the hotel, making the floors wet and generally causing mayhem. Point to note: The pool closes at 19.00hrs for paying guests, but has no time limit for non paying guests

As for the actual karaoke, this gets totally taken over by the students. The noise is so loud from their shouting that you can't use the restaurant. They also take over the bar so we can't get a drink. Point to note: The bar closes at 23.00hrs for paying guests, but 23.30 or later for non paying guests

Some nights, the management think that the best solution is to move paying guests and put them in a conference room for dinner so that the students can still enjoy themselves. The conference room is basically a box with no windows.

A point to note, there is only one bar and one restaurant at the hotel and they are attached to each other and with lovely sea views. The conference room is a box with no windows and one door.

The complaints the hotel have received are constant and plentiful. The management and guest relations openly admit that all nationalities are complaining. But they do nothing to help the paying guests. I have spoken to the management right up to the main general manager. Whilst they sympathise, they say they can't do anything because they need the extra money.

The hotel has a 5 star sister hotel. I suggested they could move paying guests there for the remainder of the holiday. The Mercury rep and Mercury head office said we could move, but only if we paid the difference. With other tour operators they would sort it, and pay the difference if needs be. Not tell the client to sort it

I complained again to both the rep and Mercury. And again we asked to be moved. But the response was the same, you can ask the hotel if they will move you, but there's nothing we can do!!!  REALLY!!! I pointed out to Mercury that our contract is with them and as such it is they who need to sort our problems.

On the penultimate night, they implemented what I had repeatedly suggested and moved the Karaoke to the conference room. However, this has a flipside. It now means hotel guests have no evening entertainment for 2 nights a week whilst the hotel entertains the students and neglects it's guests. Basically the non paying students are more important than it's paying guests

Honestly this whole experience has been quite possibly the worst ever. We have NEVER stayed in a hotel that puts non paying people, before their paying guests. On a positive, the staff, food and drink are all fantastic. It's a shame they are let down by management that are more interested in running a cabaret bar than a hotel
column13: This is not run as a hotel

column12: This hotel is not 4star in need of updating and some maintenance rooms are spacious bathrooms very small lovely views Hotel right on the lovely beach food great nice staff but unfortunately not all as enthusiastic as others or as good as other hotels visited  our waiter Nuwun was excellent The worst two nights are karaoke nights but not for the guest this is a glorified student party night bud loads of them come thro the door screaming jumping in the pool in their  underwear running riot around the hotel none of which could be controlled floors all wet screaming down the Mike no regard for hotel guest we could not sit in the bar area or get a drink unless edited went to get it for us some guest went to their rooms or went out this is every Wednesday and Thursday complained to managing director who did move guest in the the ball room for Dinner but we were still subjected to this when we had finished Dinner hotel seems more interested in bringing money by any means with out considering hotel guest already paid these students beers using the facilities during the day who seem to think it great to take your Towels this made me feel a little uneasy to leave other belongings around would not return or recommend this hotel

column10: Value for Money
column12:
All in All it was a good holiday, value for money I should say, cannot expect a five star treatment from a three star hotel. Rooms and the toilets are quite old and small.
 First day dinner was not to our expectation, Samapth front office Manager was  nice enough to listen to our remarks and checked wit us constantly about the improvement in food, for our surprise from the next meal onwards  all the dishes complimented  well with each other and there was a variety. this hotel has a beautiful sea shore very close to the hotel and what we loved the most was the high table made in cement and the high chairs on the sea shore , sipping mocktails and cocktails listening to the sounds of the waves and sea salt breeze.. Loved that experience... even at 10pm we were in the beach chatting away walking in the water. Mano De Silva, General Manager was welcoming and ensured we had a pleasant holiday. Both Sampath & Mano always with a smile, staff was friendly and helpful.
column13: Great stay !!  Rooms need a revamp

column12:
We enjoyed our 4 night all inclusive stay post our tour around Sri Lanka.

Check in was swift and we were given a room with lovely views on top floor. The room had a large balcony with views of beach and pool. 

Room was quite spacious with flat screen TV with many satellite channels. There was a fridge, kettle, safe deposit box and plenty of storage. Bathroom had a walk in shower. It was small but adequate. 

Food in dining room was generally good but limited vegetarian choices were on offer on some days. However the chef was happy to prepare other vegetarian dishes which I did order on a couple of days.

There was only 1 bar by the restaurant and they had a range of local beers, wines, spirits and cocktails on offer for all inclusive guests. I would have preferred another bar near the reception area. Also there was limted seating near reception area. Would have liked more indoor seating areas which would be useful on rainy days. 

However the beach was nice and turtle beach was only 5 minutes walk away where we got to see turtles on a couple of days. Also one could swim at turtle beach. Swimming was not allowed on beach opposite hotel when we were there due to rough seas.

Pool was small but adequate. It was constantly kept clean by pool attendant who was friendly. The team at reception was very friendly too and looked after all our needs.

Outside the hotel, there were plenty of shops, bars and restaurants. There is also a supermarket directly opposite the hotel.

Evening entertainment was generally low key but pleasant. However on one evening they had a DJ who played bollywood/Sri Lankan music and everyone danced away despite the heavy rain outside. 

We would be happy to visit this hotel perhaps in the drier season. However I would like the hotel to add another bar area and more indoor seating areas for their guests.
column13: 4 nights pleasant beach stay after our week long tour of Sri Lanka!

column12: It was my family outing to Citrus Hikkaduwa last week. The hotel location is great. The staff is friendly but the front office crew needs to be more pleasant with the visitors because compared with the other hotels we visited, we didn't get the welcome that we expected. This place has a very nice beach and it is very clean and also they have a good swimming pool. The room was too small and had a partial sea view. They have less variety of foods but the foods are super delicious. Special Thanks should go to Mr David(who might be the F&B manager) who is a very smiley and friendly person and the entire restaurant crew. Overall the stay is good but this place needs to be improved and renovated.

column12:
We enjoyed a delightful 2-night stay here over the April school holidays.

The check-in process was smooth, and we are grateful to Damith, Sandun, Nadun, and the front office team for accommodating our requests. Damith was extremely helpful and ensured that our stay was unforgettable.

The children had a fantastic time playing in the sea, soaking up the sun, and building sandcastles.

The food, cocktails, and service were all excellent. A big thank you to the chef and his team (Nimal, Thilina, Nandana, Nuwan, Sampath, Chinthaka, Gerad, Kaushalya, & Sathsarani).

Looking forward to our next visit!
DH

column12: The Hotel staff are what makes  this such a lovely place to stay . It does need a bit of TLC in places( our bathroom could’ve done with an upgrade)  but overall our  room was comfortable and clean . We had a top floor room with a fabulous view of the Indian Ocean. There was always a good choice of food in the restaurant every day  and the staff were always  helpful-  special mention to Chinthaka who was always so attentive to us and made the dining experience so much  more enjoyable - Thank you  ! He is a real asset to the hotel . Also a mention to Gerard in the restaurant . The hotel location is great-  direct access to the beach and across the road from a large supermarket . We would definitely go back - It was  a lovely experience and  we would recommend to anyone for a relaxing and value for money holiday .

column12: Wonderful hotel. We had a rest with family in September. We liked everything. The hotel is small and cozy, very kind and friendly staff. The voucher included breakfast and dinner. The food is delicious. When there was no buffet, they invited food with beautiful presentation. The hotel is located right on the beach and has its own pool. Turtles and fish swim within a five-minute walk. We went out of season, so there was renovation going on, but it did not have a negative impact

Such a pretty view of the sea from the sun beds and pool!

column12:
We have been travelling around Sri Lanka for the last 14 days with 12 friends and decided, on the spur of the moment to book in to the Coral Rock by Bansei hotel for the last 5 nights of our stay.
We were met at reception by a stunning young lady who made us feel welcome from the moment we walked in.
The food is amazing, I had the best works beef burger, the beer is icy cold (we are Aussies and love cold beer) and the staff couldn't have done any more for us.
The rooms are great, the whole Hotel is very well presented. We even had our towels made in to little love hearts.
I am sitting on the pool deck enjoying the sun while watching the waves crash on the shore
I would highly recommend this hotel.
Cheers

column12:
The Coral Rock by Bansei hotel in Sri Lanka, in the Hikkaduwa area, left me with the most pleasant impressions.  The first thing that pleased me was the location of the hotel on the first line by the sea.  The room had a beautiful view of the endless ocean, which created a unique atmosphere of relaxation and tranquility.

 The room I stayed in was spacious, comfortable and clean.  All necessary amenities were available, making the stay as comfortable as possible.  The service at the hotel was top notch - the staff were friendly, attentive and responsible.

 The hotel pool also had an excellent location - overlooking the sea.  I spent a lot of time on the sun lounger, enjoying the sun and the coolness of the pool at the same time.

 The cuisine at the hotel deserves special mention - breakfasts and dinners were varied and delicious.  I was able to try various Sri Lankan and international cuisines.

 I highly recommend Coral Rock by Bansei in Sri Lanka if you are looking for the perfect place to relax by the sea with comfort and excellent service.

column10: Check out the “spa” before you book a session
column12:
We love this hotel. 
We had a sea view room. It was such a calming experience where I could hear the sound of waves inside the room !
They provide basic amenities although you have to bring your own toothbrush and toothpaste. The location was good, you can just walk out and there are shops along the road. One can easily find this hotel.
We had our dinner and breakfast by the pool over looking the ocean. Good food with stunning view.
This is the hotel I would definitely go back !

About the spa.. I won’t call it a spa though. The set up is like those roadside massage parlor although the massage was good.

column10: Make sure you get a sea view & definitely try the restaurant as the food was delicious.
column12:
Spent 5 nights here at the end of our holiday. Its a fantastic hotel. The staff were lovely & friendly - nothing was too much trouble. 

The food was gorgeous- buffet style breakfast with something for everyone. We also ate here a couple of evenings and the food was outstanding. 

Its right on the beach and in the middle of everything. 

I would definitely come here again & would highly recommend.

We had a great stay at this hotel as the last place of our 2-week holiday in Sri Lanka.it was the best choice. The hotel is by the ocean side and the rooms look onto the ocean. 
The food was also great, the hotel dinners are exceptionally good. The satff was very kind, we got most help from Uresha, who was very kind and helpful in all situations with us. 
I can recommend this place for all who want a great relaxing place and like snorkeling.

The hotel staff was very attentive to our needs and always ready to help with any questions.

I highly recommend Hotel Coral Rock by Bansei to anyone looking to relax by the ocean and make unforgettable memories on their vacation.

column12:
It was a real enjoyment being here during my holidays. The service was very hospitable and welcome. The dinners were exceptional and never the same during my 8 days experience here. It was also very convenient to have a beach and all beach facilities right in the hotels terrace. 
There were drawbacks too like outdated furniture in the room (for instance hairdryer was barely heating) and construction works in the neighboring building 

As for the furniture - it didn’t bother us at all, cause overall experience was nice - the room was clean and smelled good. 
As for the construction works - i understand that this was not the responsibility of the hotel stuff and they cannot do anything with it. Sometimes the noise was heard, sometimes it didn’t - all depends on the day of the week. All in all, it wasn’t too loud so it was possible to relax. 

Thanks a lot to the stuff for these incredible days in Sri Lanka!

Great location with nice entry to sea. Great food and drinks! Also the staff is very nice.
Beach is very short, but there is plenty of sunbeds by the pool on the terace. Could have more umbrellas.
Rooms with street view are a bit noisy as the road is quite busy.

column6: {'id': '14968725', 'name': 'Riff Hikkaduwa', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 445, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.119619, 'longitude': 80.115555, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d14968725-Reviews-Riff_Hikkaduwa-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://riffhikkaduwa.com/offers/', 'address': 'No. 870 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80244 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'No. 870 Galle Rd', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80244'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 9, 'count2': 2, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 24, 'count5': 402}}
column12:
We enjoyed a short stay at Riff Hikkaduwa - and loved every minute.  Our room was clean and really comfortable with a fantastic view out to the beach and Indian Ocean.  The hotel has a real chic feel about it - and the staff without exception are incredibly friendly and welcoming.  We have to give a huge shout out to the hotel driver who picked us up and dropped us off at Colombo Airport - as well as taking us out for a day to Yala National Park where we had the good fortune to not only see elephants and mugger crocodiles but also a leopard.

Breakfast was excellent and both restaurants have good food and varied menus.  This was our first visit to Sri Lanka and the hotel was well placed to not only relax but to also see some of the country, the Old Fort in Galle being another great visit.

And loved the "towel elephant" left on our bed on our last night !!
column13: Perfect Ocean Views and Comfortable Rooms

column12:
An unforgettable experience at Riff Hikkaduwa during the weekend from 31st Aug to 01st Sep. Celebrated DS Senanayake Collage 88 Ledgen's party with 84 batchmates. From the GM to all capacities of staff were exceptionally great and the beautiful property added value because of them. The rooms were very clean, and the food was exceptional with a good spread.  All staff were up till 2AM with smiling faces letting us enjoy to the maximum. We decided to visit this place even with our families. Thanks to all for lovely hospitality. 
Sajitha D Sumanasekera
column13: Beautiful clean location/good food with amazing staff with full of hospitality.

column10: The hotel is located outside of Hikkaduwa. You can take a Tuk Tuk or a bus to town. The street is right in front of the hotel.
column12: The design of the hotel is beautiful and the staff is incredibly helpful and friendly. Theekshana greeted us every day with her most beautiful laugh. If you’re looking for a beach hotel with direct access to the beach, it is a good place to go.
column13: Design hotel with direct beach access and great rooftop bar
