{'id': '964706901', 'text': "Dear valued guest,

First of all, we thank you for this wonderful review and recommendation. We are truly honoured by your high praise, especially given your extensive travel experience. It's gratifying to hear that you found our hotel to offer excellent value for money and that our design and attention to detail impressed you.

We take great pride in our commitment to sustainability, and it’s heartening to know that our efforts resonated with you. Your acknowledgment means a lot to us.

We look forward to welcoming you back for another memorable visit.", 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-08-13', 'responder': 'Iroshan Chanaka Dassanayaka', 'connectionToSubject': 'Owner'}
column6: {'id': '14968725', 'name': 'Riff Hikkaduwa', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 445, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.119619, 'longitude': 80.115555, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d14968725-Reviews-Riff_Hikkaduwa-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://riffhikkaduwa.com/offers/', 'address': 'No. 870 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80244 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'No. 870 Galle Rd', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80244'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 9, 'count2': 2, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 24, 'count5': 402}}
column12:
I’ve stayed in a lot hotels around the world, whether for business or pleasure, so I’m confident that I know what ‘good’ and ‘bad’ looks like. 

I can honestly say the Riff is one of the best hotels I’ve stayed in when considering value for money. The design of the hotel is excellent in every way and the attention to detail would put some Dubai luxury hotels to shame. 

When it comes to sustainability it’s clear they really care rather than the hollow claims of many hotel chains. 

I would happily return.

column5:
{'id': '960605684', 'text': 'Dear valued guest,\xa0

First of all, we thank you for this beautiful review and recommendation. Thank you so much for choosing Riff Hikkaduwa to celebrate such a momentous moment in your life. It means a great deal to us that you chose our hotel for your honeymoon and then returned with your parents the following month.

We’re delighted that you enjoyed our warm hospitality, clean and well-maintained rooms, and the calm atmosphere of our beachfront location. It’s wonderful to know that the stunning views and easy beach access added to your enjoyment.

We’re especially pleased that our cuisine, particularly the biriyani, was a highlight of your stay. We’re also grateful for your kind mention of our staff’s efforts in making your dining experience special, particularly in catering to your mother’s vegetarian needs. We’ll be sure to pass on your compliments to Benisha and the rest of the team.

Thank you once again for choosing Riff Hikkaduwa. We look forward to welcoming you back for another wonderful stay!', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-07-21', 'responder': 'Iroshan Chanaka Dassanayaka', 'connectionToSubject': 'Owner'}
column6: {'id': '14968725', 'name': 'Riff Hikkaduwa', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 445, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.119619, 'longitude': 80.115555, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d14968725-Reviews-Riff_Hikkaduwa-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://riffhikkaduwa.com/offers/', 'address': 'No. 870 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80244 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'No. 870 Galle Rd', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80244'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 9, 'count2': 2, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 24, 'count5': 402}}
column12:
We visited Riff Hikkaduwa last month for our honeymoon and loved the experience so much that we decided to bring our parents this month to enjoy the same. From the moment we arrived, we received a warm welcome from the staff. The rooms were clean, well-maintained, and the overall atmosphere of the hotel was calm and peaceful. One of the best parts of our stay was the hotel's beachfront location, providing us with stunning views and easy access to the beach.

The food was absolutely delicious. In fact, our return trip was largely motivated by the warm hospitality and fantastic cuisine. Everyone in our group enjoyed the meals, especially the biriyani, which was incredibly flavorful and generously filled with chicken pieces and cashews. We were even able to thank the chef personally for making the best biriyani we've ever had.

Special mention goes to the waitress, Benisha. She remembered us from our previous visit and was extremely helpful, always suggesting the best dishes for us to try and doing so with a big smile. She made our dining experience even more enjoyable. Additionally, since my mother is a vegetarian, Benisha provided her with a full board menu featuring a variety of vegetarian dishes, which was very thoughtful and appreciated.

Thank you so much, Riff Hikkaduwa, for making our stay memorable. We truly enjoyed every moment and look forward to visiting again.
column13: A Perfect Retreat at Riff Hikkaduwa: Exceptional Hospitality and Delicious Cuisine

column5:

First of all, we thank you for this beautiful review and recommendation. We’re delighted to hear that your stay with us was unforgettable and that you enjoyed our location, views, and the beautiful setting of the hotel.

It’s wonderful to know that both the pool and beach access contributed to a memorable experience for you and your family. We’re especially grateful for your kind words about our staff. We’re thrilled to hear that their care and attention helped make your stay special.

We would love to welcome you and your family back for another fantastic visit. Thank you once again for choosing Riff Hikkaduwa!', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-07-21', 'responder': 'Iroshan Chanaka Dassanayaka', 'connectionToSubject': 'Owner'}

column10: Lovely high chair available for little ones as well as a bucket and spade.
column12:
We stayed at the hotel as a party of 5 (myself, my husband, our 18 month old & my parents) for 3 nights. We had an unforgettable experience. 

The location, the staff, the views and the understated beauty of the hotel made for a special few days. We could happily have stayed longer. You have the best of both worlds, an enormous pool (that you can swim lengths in, hoorah!) and beach access just 4 steps away. Simply stunning. 

A special thank you to Theekshana who was so beautifully accommodating of our daughter and couldn't do enough to care and tailor our experience from the time we arrived until our check out.

column10: Both restaurants are awesome!
column12:
It was a wonderful stay in Riff Hikkaduwa, amazing beach view at the room with a spacious balcony, the room design is very modern.
What is most impressive is their restaurants - didn’t expect we could have such decent quality of Japanese food at their rooftop Japanese restaurants. The breakfast sets served at their G/F restaurant were amazingly delicious and fruitful.
Our stay wouldn’t be that wonderful without all the very warm and helpful staff - they also gave us a very decent tea gift when we were departing. Definitely a worth stay!

column12: We stayed over at Riff Hikkaduwa for a nights stay. This has to be one of the best service and quality experiences we’ve had in a while! Check in check out was very smooth, meals were exceptional, service standards were highly maintained, rooms and hotel in general was very well maintained! It was a delightful stay for us! We will surely visit again! Also worth the price you pay… everything was above and beyond what we expected! We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone!

column5:
{'id': '959095718', 'text': "Dear Rebecca,

Thank you so much for your heartwarming review and recommendation! We are overjoyed to hear that you had such a fantastic experience at Riff Hikkaduwa. It's wonderful to know that you enjoyed the stunning views from your room, our food offerings, and the overall atmosphere of our hotel.

We are especially grateful for your kind words about our staff, the entire team strive to create a welcoming and soulful environment for our guests, and it's incredibly rewarding to hear that their love and generosity made such a positive impact on your stay.

Your heartfelt connections and the full heart you left with are exactly what we aim to achieve with every guest. We're thrilled that you appreciated the gifts we provided as a token of our gratitude.

Thank you for choosing Riff Hikkaduwa and for sharing your love for our place. We hope to welcome you back in the future.

With much love,
The Riff Hikkaduwa Team", 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-07-11', 'responder': 'Iroshan Chanaka Dassanayaka', 'connectionToSubject': 'Owner'}

column12:
I am beyond grateful that I chose Riff Hikkaduwa as my hotel while solo traveling in Sri Lanka. The rooms offer gorgeous views, the staff is phenomenal, the food is amazing, and the overall atmosphere is fantastic. The soulful people who work here truly enhance the experience. I left this place with a full heart due to the connections I made with the people here. I experienced so much love and generosity.

I really can't thank Shaa enough and all the wonderful people who crossed my path here. Finally, I want to thank the staff and management for all the gifts they gave me to take home.

So much love for this place.

Rebecca

column10: You should experience the wonderful pool. It’s filled with sea water 🤩
column12: Our stay at Riff Hikkaduwa was splendid. We had a wonderful time. The rooms were luxurious and comfortable. The food was excellent. Really delicious. Even it’s on A la cart , the restaurant staff was willing to provide food according to our requirements. The restaurant staff was very friendly, supportive and courteous. Theekshana and Bimanka was really friendly and helpful. Almost all the staff members were very friendly and courteous. The spa was above the expectation. Superb. The treatments were very methodical and worth. The management head Rockshi was really helpful and friendly. We had a memorable time at Riff Hikkaduwa and I can recommend it as one the best hotels in Sri Lanka. I would love to visit there again. Good luck 🤞♥️
column13: The wonderful stay at Riff Hikkaduwa. I can recommend anyone to stay with them.

column12:
Without doubt the best hotels in hikkaduwa and possibly one of the best in sri lanka. 
All the staff were amazing, kind and always helpful. I mentioned it was our honeymoon and they went the extra mile to make it feel special.
The design and decor is particularly impressive throughout the hotel. The hotel is right on the beach with an incredible view and soothing sea breeze.
The hotel manager Raymond was  great and made sure any small problems we had were quickly ironed out.
The food from both restaurants were delicious and again the service from all the staff was 5 star. We stayed in the Marriott in Weligama and this hotel is way better than the Marriott. 

Thank you RIFF team we will be back for sure

column12: "Had an absolutely delightful experience at Riff. The food was exceptional, with a diverse menu that catered to various tastes and dietary preferences. column12:
Riff Hikkaduwa was one of the best hotels I've been to in the recent past.
The ambiance, interiors', staff and most importantly the food were simply exceptional! Every meal was one to look forward to and each course was delectable and creative. 
Rooms were spacious, clean and well serviced, with a stunning view of the sea. 
The hotel is highly recommended for anyone looking for a relaxed stay in a truly luxury beach property!
Thank you Riff for a memorable stay!

column6: {'id': '14968725', 'name': 'Riff Hikkaduwa', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 445, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.119619, 'longitude': 80.115555, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d14968725-Reviews-Riff_Hikkaduwa-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://riffhikkaduwa.com/offers/', 'address': 'No. 870 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80244 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'No. 870 Galle Rd', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80244'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 9, 'count2': 2, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 24, 'count5': 402}}
column12:
I’m don’t usually go full Karen-mode, but I’ve had two bad experiences at Riff Hikkaduwa in a span of 5 days, so I wanted to share my experience with others.

The first time when me and my husband went to Riff, I was served raw chicken. They first said it’ll take 10 minutes to re-do the dish, and after the 10 minutes had passed, they suddenly said it’ll take another 15 minutes. We had only planned an hour for our lunch, so we had to leave and I had to be hungry for the rest of the day.

We tried our luck again, the second time we went to the Japanese rooftop restaurant. When we first went up, we were seated at the bar “while they fix a table for us”. We sat there for 10 minutes, without seeing any progress with our table, while there were at least 2 empty tables where we could’ve easily been seated to. Also there were groups of people coming in who got a table and service before us, even though we were there first.

When we finally got seated and served the food, it was very good. “Worth the wait,” we thought. In reality, we were hit again with a long waiting time for dessert which took them 50 minutes to bring out. The servers had little to none attention to us, we had to be the ones who made ourselves seen. 

Safe to say I’m incredibly dissapointed. I had super high hopes for this hotel as it looks absolutely stunning, but we gave it a chance twice, and it failed us both times.
column13: May be a beautiful hotel but not a great dining experience

column12:
Fantastic stay at a great hotel. Brilliant service.
We spent the first four nights of our Sri Lanka trip at Riff. As a a family of 5 we had two first floor junior suites - and had a great time. The best hotel on our stay and one we would highly recommend to others.
Beautiful beach, instagrammable pool and roof top bar views. Fantastic breakfasts. Staff very friendly.
No real negatives at all - but being picky, the hotel gym wasn’t that good and could do with a bit of investment.

column10: Engage with the staff they'll truly look after you
column12:
This was our second visit to The Riff with the last one being back in 2018. It was great to be back again and even better being treated well for being returning guests coming for the second time.
What stood out this time is the quality of the food and the people. Everybody who works there is testament of a great hospitality business and how-to look after customers.
From the front of house to the bar staff to the waiters , everybody is just so nice, warm and welcoming it just makes it a pleasure staying there. One person does stand out and that is the pool guy, he just goes overboard on everything he does and is paramount in providing a truly great service.
Thanks to all the staff and people who again made out holiday so enjoyable and pleasurable. We hope to see you again in December

column12:
We had a very nice stay at the Riff. I arrived early so the staff kindly helped me use thr library which was very comfortable until the room could be allotted.
The food is the best. The chef is amazing and we enjoyed Srilankan and International cuisine. The juices so fresh and we just couldn't get enough of the food. It is so good that we never wanted to eat outside even though the hotel is conveniently located near so many bars and restaurants. The desserts are not only visually appealing but super tasty.
We used the SPA, this needs improvement definitely but I am sure they can in due course.
On the rooms, good size and amazing views of the Indian Ocean and the beach is lovely. 
The staff is lovely like all people in Srilanka.
However, the bathroom door is all glass opens towards the bedroom, generally in hotels bathroom doors entry is through the foyer area. 
There is a blind that you have to keep rolling up and down incase u need to get in and out of the bathroom. Very inconvenient. If there is scope, they should work on improving this as this causes a lot of inconvenience while sharing the room and at night could be disturbing with rolling up and down of the blinds to get in and out of the bathroom.

column12:
We ate dinner in the rooftop restaurant as the sun set - it was beautiful.

There was a live musician and he did a fair job but we couldn't listen to him for too long as his pronounciation was quite poor.  

The food was great, lovely sushi.  The staff were lovely.

column10: Go to the rooftop bar for sundowners
column12:
We had a fantastic stay in Riff Hikkaduwa in December 2023. Everything was amazing from start to finish and we would 100% go back. The nicest hotel in Hikkaduwa by far and a true 5 star.

We arrived at 8am off our flight and they offered us a complimentary breakfast when we arrived. You could not fault the hotel staff in any way, they were always so helpful and friendly. They allowed us to use the reception phone when our flight was cancelled which was very kind.

Our room was beautiful and always replenished with towels, toiletries and well cleaned every day. The pool area was amazing, super clean and well maintained. Special thanks to the man at the pool (not sure of his name) who we made great friends with over the 5 days and always accommodated us with beds before we even asked.

We ate in all of the restaurants and the food was of very high standard, not a bad meal once. The homemade granola qt breakfast was particularly delicious! We booked the Romantic Getaway, had a bottle of wine on arrival, a gorgeous 5 course meal at the pool and an excellent 30 minute couples massage. 

The hotel is located in a quieter part of the beach which we loved as we strolled down to the other bars/restaurants in the evenings. The view from the rooftop bar is incredible and it was lovely relaxing vibes. 

Highly recommend this hotel! I am thinking about booking another trip even writing this!

column6: {'id': '14968725', 'name': 'Riff Hikkaduwa', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 445, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.119619, 'longitude': 80.115555, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d14968725-Reviews-Riff_Hikkaduwa-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://riffhikkaduwa.com/offers/', 'address': 'No. 870 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80244 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'No. 870 Galle Rd', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80244'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 9, 'count2': 2, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 24, 'count5': 402}}
column12:
The most amazing week at Riff, Hikkaduwa! 
If you are looking for the perfect get away to enjoy the beautiful Sri Lankan coastline, then make sure to book in at Riff Hikkaduwa. 

The bright and airy lobby welcomes you to the hotel, with views of the infinity pool and ocean greeting you as you arrive. A nice fresh fruit juice was given to us as we checked in, before being shown to our rooms. 

The focus on sustainability and natural feel is evident throughout the hotel. With lots of natural light and soothing decor. The rooms are large and spacious and well stocked with all the amenities that you require. Laundry prices are very reasonable and our room attendants did a fantastic job at keeping our room clean and tidy during the stay.

Throughout the stay we were welcomed by the amazing staff, Bashiyna was one of the ladies who was our waitress throughout and her beautiful smile and warm personality made our breakfasts, lunches or dinner a delight. 
The menu offers a selection of Western and local dishes giving plenty of options to try. The Japanese restaurant on the roof top provides high quality dishes for all tastes!

The staff on reception were very help in arranging a few tours for us, one to Galle and one to Udawalawe National Park. Both drivers were very kind and a wealth of information about what we were seeing and explaining local traditions and cultures to us. They also arranged our return journey to the airport in Colombo. 

The hotel is on the beach, meaning that you can easily go for walks down the beach to surf or visit Turtle Beach. 

As we were statying over New Year, we were lucky to be part of the NYE celebrations at the hotel. The hotel provided an amazing evening, with a extensive buffet, drinks, music and traditional dances. All the staff worked so hard to pull off the evening, and we are grateful for their efforts. 

Every member of staff, from the owner, general manager, waiters/ waitresses etc were incredibly friendly and welcoming. We left feeling like friends! 

The hotel had a mixture of families and couples staying, making it the perfect get away for everyone. We left feeling relaxed and rejuvenated, 
We will definitely be returning to this incredible hotel
column13: A slice of paradise in Hikkaduwa

column6: {'id': '606377', 'name': 'Aditya Resort', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 939, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.094894, 'longitude': 80.134705, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d606377-Reviews-Aditya_Resort-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.aditya-resort.com', 'address': '719/1 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '719/1 Galle Rd', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80240'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 5, 'count2': 7, 'count3': 17, 'count4': 73, 'count5': 837}}
column12:
Our stay at Aditya Resort Rathgama from August 25th to 27th, 2024, was nothing short of perfect. We stayed in the spacious Vayu Pool Villa, which was well-maintained and provided a tranquil retreat with a pristine private pool. The villa’s layout offered comfort, luxury, and privacy—ideal for a relaxing holiday.

Breakfasts at the resort began with a fresh fruit platter featuring a delightful selection of local fruits, a wonderful start to each day. The Sri Lankan breakfast with flavorful beef and fish curries was a standout, showcasing authentic local cuisine. For lunch, our parents enjoyed a delicious serving of fish and chips, while the southern-style fish in banana wrap was splendidly prepared and packed with flavor.

Dinner arrangements were memorable, with the first night set up on the beach for our family of six, including our parents. The beachside ambiance paired with a delicious meal made it an evening to remember. On the second night, our dinner in the garden, surrounded by candlelight under a starry sky, was truly magical. The fish was perfectly prepared, and our eight-year-old son loved the fish and chips so much he wanted it again!

To end the meals on a sweet note, we indulged in the chocolate chip sundae for dessert, which was absolutely fabulous and worth every bite.

The serene beachfront, attentive hospitality, and Aditya’s overall ambiance make it an idyllic holiday getaway. From the front desk to the restaurant team, the staff’s genuine warmth and dedication made us feel truly at home. We highly recommend Aditya Resort Rathgama for anyone seeking a beautiful, peaceful retreat on Sri Lanka’s coast.
column13: A Perfect Getaway at Aditya Resort Rathgama - August 2024

There is a pillow menu for better quality sleep.

column12: We stayed in the Surya suite for our honeymoon, and it was such an incredible experience. I had been trying to decide between the pool suite and Surya, but the privacy and space in Surya made it the best choice for us. We had our own plunge pool on the rooftop with views of the ocean, sun chairs, a giant shower, living room space, covered patio, and even an outdoor toilet on the rooftop (to avoid going down the stairs at night) in addition to one in the traditional bathroom. Not only did the room feel super luxurious, but the food was delicious, and we enjoyed the spa services as well. We found luxury in the details of the hotel- such as welcome snacks in the room, a congratulations cake and card, no fees for room service,  no closures of the restaurant between meal times, the beautiful fresh flowers everywhere, and the constant care of the staff. We hope to some day stay again!

column5:
{'id': '969257458', 'text': 'Dear Ms. Sonali,

Thank you so much for your kind words and for taking the time to share your experience at Aditya Resort! We are thrilled to hear that you and your friends had such a memorable stay while celebrating your friend’s 60th birthday.

It was our pleasure to welcome you with aralia garlands and passion fruit juice, and we’re delighted that you felt so at home with us. Our team is committed to creating a warm and inviting atmosphere, and your praise is a wonderful affirmation of their efforts.

We’re also pleased that you enjoyed the villa’s charm and serene ambiance. It was a joy to host you, and we can’t wait to welcome you back for another special occasion or simply a relaxing getaway.

column12:
An Unforgettable Stay at Adithya Boutique Villa!

We had the pleasure of staying at Adithya Boutique Villa on the 7th of September, 2024, with a group of friends to celebrate a special occasion—our friend’s 60th birthday. From the moment we arrived, we were treated like celebrities! We were warmly greeted with beautiful aralia garlands and a refreshing passion fruit juice as our welcome drink, setting the tone for what would be an incredible experience.

The staff at Adithya Boutique Villa went above and beyond to make our stay memorable. They were not only attentive but always smiling, creating such a friendly and welcoming atmosphere. Their hospitality made us feel truly at home.

The villa itself is stunning, with its charming décor and serene ambiance making it the perfect getaway. We stayed for just one night, but it was an experience we’ll remember for a long time. Thank you, Adithya Boutique Villa, for an unforgettable stay. We can’t wait to return!

This should capture the essence of your experience while highlighting the key details!

column12:
I celebrated  my 60th B’day with all of my besties at Aditya this weekend. 

From the time I chose Aditya and made a reservation I was given the maximum support by the General manager Mr. Shamindra Fernando and the resident manager Mr. Susil. Every aspect of the arrangement were discussed and arranged to my absolute satisfaction. 

On arrival we were garlanded with fragrant frangipane flowers and served delicious fresh passion juice….there followed a wonderful tea service in the garden… we then chillaxed near the bar and the pool and thereafter dressed up for evening cocktails with delicious canapés and a super al fresco 4 course dinner under the stars. 

The staff, the service, the ambience, the decor,  the quality of the meals were amazing. 

On returning to my suite my room had been decorated to resemble a fairyland of candles with a wonderful banner wishing me a fabulous birthday. I have never been this spoilt and was truly touched by the care taken to make this day so special for me. 

Thank you Aditya for  making my dream of an amazing birthday come to life. 

Me and my guests were totally blown away❤️❤️❤️
column13: Perfect place for a milestone birthday

column12: I have been to a lot of hotels in Sri Lanka but after staying in Aditya for 4 days I did NOT want to leave the place, this villa is something else. The staff is unmatchable, I haven't received such a friendly and efficient service anywhere else, they served us like we were a part of their family. The food was delicious, and every dish we had was the best we have ever had. And the cleanliness in the resort was on point. The GM, Mr Susil and the team were very friendly and made us feel like home. Everyone had smiles that we would never forget! Highly recommend this villa.

column10: Just relax and unwind yourselves
column12:
My wife and I spent spent 4 blissful days in this resort from the 15th to the 18th July 24. The resort is a wonderful combination of view, charm, elegance, finesse, merged with the ever so courteous staff and delicious food. We could never have bargained for anything more and left the resort at the end of our stay with great regret. The ever so willing to help nature of the staff was very comforting and we were made to feel nothing was ever missing. Susil, the Reservation Manager mad us feel so wanted and ensured our comforts. I would love to be here again. 
Angelo & Jacintha Patrick
Colombo.
column13: Peace and Serenity in the Aditya Resort, Sri Lanka

column12:
There are no words to describe how wonderful this hotel is. We were met by Shamindra and his team who went above and beyond to make our stay truly unforgettable. What's remarkable is that everyone working at Aditya feels like a family member, they all give their all in everything they do and they do so with a smile. 

The rooms are exceptionally large and the bathrooms are incredible. The bathroom is an open concept with a big jacuzzi. 

The food was amazing as well and they have so many options whether it's authentic Sri Lankan food or Western food. The choice is yours and no one will say no to you if you want to mix and match. 

We loved the beach and even though we couldn't swim in the ocean it felt like a private stretch of beautiful sandy beach. 

Thank you for making our stay so special and we highly recommend it to anyone looking for a truly unique experience.

column12: This boutique hotel was one of the best I have stayed in all over the world. The room was huge, with a plunge pool in the bathroom and a massive shower. Both bedroom and bathroom had a lovely view of the pool and the beautiful Indian Ocean beyond. All the food was delicious with lovely presentation. The service every day was without fault. Thank you Aditya-it's a shame I couldn't stay longer than 4 nights!

column12: We celebrated a birthday with friends from the UK, Germany and Sri Lanka. Aditya was an exceptional venue for a special celebration. The service was superb as was the birthday dinner; in fact the food was excellent throughout our stay. We were able to have a live band and dancing, which made the evening memorable. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff and management. Our guests were treated to a luxurious and memorable experience. One of our guests required a special gluten free diet and Aditya staff looked after her food requirements with care. We were all cared for with that special Aditya touch. Once again a memorable stay  and we would love to repeat it again!
column13: A truly memorable birthday celebration with friends!

column10: Put your Phone away and forget everything! The staff and setting takes you away to paradise
column12: From the moment we arrived at Aditya we were treated like royalty! The beautiful ambience and setting is wonderfully calming! The access to the beach is a few steps away where we walked along the shore marvelling at the rugged beauty of the area! The suite we stayed in was nothing short of spectacular! Definitely the best hotel we’ve ever stayed in! Everything was made perfect by the staff who were tripping over themselves to please us! The level of service we received is highly commended! Such training they’ve been given with every detail thought carefully through! We simply didn’t want to leave! The choice of food was brilliant and everything was fresh and delicious! I cannot recommend highly enough! We’ll be back for sure

column10: Get the sea facing rooms and book the spa a day in advance
column12: This place is an absolute 10 on 10. My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights in May 2024. The property is gorgeous and is right on the beach. The staff is polite and attentive to your requirements.  One day I came from a beach walk and was sitting at the restaurant waiting for my food. Since the weather was hot, I was sweating a bit. Noticing this their restaurant staff got me a cold face towel without me asking for it. Special thanks to  Thiwanka and Indika from the restaurant staff for taking good care of us. The food is amazing and the Sri Lankan dishes are a must try. The spa staff are so good at what they do. I will surely visit this place again.

column12:
Having had a very brief but hugely memorable stay in Aditya way back in 2012, I was so happy to return, this time with my husband. This was to be our final stop on a 10 day adventure travelling round the country, so we were looking forward to total relaxation.

We stayed in the beautiful Aditi Villa - a stunning villa with a huge outside area complete with private pool and shaded terrace with a gently swinging day bed. Our own private lawn where we watched the local mongoose family tootle across each day, lead directly onto the beach.

It was really bad timing that I had started to develop a dental infection, which stopped me in my tracks not long after we arrived! But to be honest, this is when you really see the true heart of a place and it's people. 
I was gutted to cancel our anniversary dinner, especially when we saw the efforts the team had gone to for us. (sparkly light, flowers...!) Not long after, there was a knock on the door and in came a concerned member of the restaurant team with a cup of ginger tea to make me feel better. They genuinely wanted to make sure I was OK.
I managed to get sorted with meds the next morning, and was able to enjoy the rest of my stay. 
The care, warmth and compassion I felt throughout our stay made me feel so relaxed and incredibly fortunate. The team really treat you like a returning friend. We felt so spoiled and genuinely cared for.

I would recommend Aditya to any client - couples or families  - anyone who would enjoy wonderful service and  food in relaxed boutique-style surroundings on a wonderfully rugged part of the Sri Lankan coastline. 

Huge thanks to all of you. Mr Shamindra, you have curated a superb team who thrive on making magical experiences for their guests with gorgeous personal touches.  You are doing amazing work.

column70: The wifi in our room was slightly spotty but it was fine in the lobby and restaurants.
column72:
We had an extraordinary stay. Top notch hospitality at every step. Staff super attentive.  We were greeted with beautifully scented araliya garlands a refreshing cool towel and fresh juices. 

And every time we came down to the restaurant or to the bar the staff would be there immediately to pull out chairs, arrange the table, make sure every need was met. They really went out of their way to reflect the highest level of Sri Lankan top class hospitality.

The pool area was lovely. 

The food delicious. The menu offerings varied providing for a mix of Sri Lankan and western tastes

What is most stunning about this hotel is the furnishings and decor. Every time I turned my head there was something else to take my breath away. All the little details everywhere. 

If you live the feeling of being in a lavishly beautiful environment, stay here.
column73: Breath taking decor and highly attentive service. Sri Lankan hospitality at its best

column12:
We stayed at Aditya for 6 days in early March 2024 and are struggling to fault it.  

The service was a highlight, with a particular shout out to Indika in the restaurant. The food was excellent, with a broad menu of both Sri Lankan and international dishes - the chef even made us an amazing Roti Kottu off menu.

A huge room with very efficient AC, and WiFi was good throughout the hotel. 

The pool was spotless and a perfect temperature.

A perfect place to wind down after touring to simply eat, read, swim and relax!

column12:
Scam. The Hotel Charges Tourists more than double the price it would usually be. "locals" would be charged 250USD whereas we were charged more than 600USD for the same Room and service. You can see on their website as you are asked if you are a srilanka resident or international. 
I am very dissapointed. I figured that you are being ripped off in SriLanka but by a 5Star Hotel and this obvious is just ridiculous. 
When confronting the Hotel and asking about the difference in price they only replied "the passport".

column10: If you want peace and quiet then we would advise that you seek an adult only alternative to the Aditya which is a great shame.
column12:
The Aditya is a tranquil, serene and well located resort hotel close to Galle. It served as a great base for our 3 week holiday. The staff and management were delightfully friendly and couldn’t do enough to make our stay very special. Additionally the food is of an extremely high standard with an extensive range of quality choice, the Chef and his staff continually produced delicious food and we had no cause for complaint about any aspect of this well run Restuarant.

Our only criticism of this location was that we are firmly of the opinion that the Aditya should definitely be an Adult only resort. The peace and quiet was completely uninterrupted until families arrived with young children and things changed significantly. There is only one pool with no facility to cater for children and this resulted in huge amounts of noise. So much so that unless the Aditya is clearly designated as Adult only, we would sadly not return in the future. A great shame as this was the only criticism we had for an otherwise ideal resort.
column13: My wife and I were looking for a 5 star hotel in the south of Sri Lanka from which we could explore this lovely island.

column12:
We were very fortunate to spend the last three days of our Sri Lanka holiday here. What an amazing boutique hotel, beautiful beach location, total tranquility.   

The huge suite was stunning with literally every detail considered.  Great welcome basket.  Spacious with super comfortable bed. Everywhere was spotless, a credit to the excellent housekeeping services.  

The pool and beach are lovely, and we were kept cool with water throughout the day.  

All of the staff provided an impeccable level of service, delivered with the utmost level of professionalism.  

We were half board and the dining experience was outstanding, beautifully presented, tasty and varied.  Loved the breakfast experience,  no set eating times above and beyond. 

Thank you 🙏 to everyone at the hotel for giving us such wonderful hospitality and memories.

column12:
Amazing boutique hotel with spacious comfortable rooms and relaxed vibe. Staff could not be more accommodating and the food for us, as vegans, was excellent. A highlight for me were the yoga classes offered by Saman Silva. He is an excellent teacher for beginners or advanced practitioners and will work either 121 or in a small group.
There is a local market just up the road each Saturday - well worth a wander - and a tuk tuk into Galle can be arranged at low cost.

column12:
Absolute paradise. We had a beautiful room with a plunge pool. Tons of space, multiple seating options. 
The service was amazing. Food delicious.
The beach was empty, but the life guard would keep an eye if you wanted so swim and set your loungers up under the shade, so you could stare into the Indian Ocean 
I shed a tear when we had to leave.

column10: One drawback, they have plunge pool in each room but water is not heated
column12: This is a unique boutique hotel close to the town of Galle. The hotel design is open plan ideal for the weather at the beach year long. The staff is very courtious and their room layouts are very unique, each a different design, huge with very high ceiling and extremely comfortable. The bathrooms are special with the rear side open to the outside looking on to the beach - very interesting. The food is also delicious, especially the breakfast

column12:
Fabulous spacious room with a private plunge pool on the deck.  Spotlessly clean and constant housekeeping throughout the stay.

Great choice of food at very reasonable prices and the restaurant staff are attentive but not intrusive.

The pool was a great temperature and again spotless.  Of the five hotels we stayed in during our trip this was the overall best pool experience.

Highly recommend this hotel for a tranquil break yet Galle is only 20 minutes away in a tuk tuk.

It was Valentine’s Day during our trip and the hotel gave us a lovely cake and a very sweet card!

column12:
Great room, service, and location. Loved it.

One feedback though was the food was bland, especially the Sri Lankan dishes. Perhaps the spice levels were low because the usual clientele is older Europeans (from what we observed) but the dishes also lacked depth which is usually because other spices were used sparingly.

column10: An ocean facing suite is worth the upgrade
column12: The hotel was beautifully situated on a really quiet beach. So peaceful. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff who would set up sunbeds anywhere you wanted on the beach, in the gardens or round the pool and provide water or drinks and snacks. Our suite was fabulous with a jacuzzi and sunbeds on a very private terrace. It was kept spotlessly clean and water provided throughout the day. We ate at the hotel as there were few restaurants recommended nearby and we were never disappointed in the food which was freshly cooked and beautifully presented. None of those awful international buffets!

column6: {'id': '606377', 'name': 'Aditya Resort', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 939, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.094894, 'longitude': 80.134705, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d606377-Reviews-Aditya_Resort-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.aditya-resort.com', 'address': '719/1 Galle Rd, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '719/1 Galle Rd', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80240'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 5, 'count2': 7, 'count3': 17, 'count4': 73, 'count5': 837}}
column12:
This hotel was the best we stayed in in Sri Lanka. Everything from the location, to the rooms, to the staff to the food was amazing.
I couldn’t fault it. 
We stayed in one of the sagosa ocean rooms and it met our expectations and more. We had a welcome basket of fruit & sweet treats. There is a plunge pool on the balcony with 2 comfortable lounging chairs and a relaxing day bed. 
The bathroom is open to the elements but private. 
There is an endless supply of water bottles. Given it was our anniversary we had a cake and they lit our room with tea lights before we retired. A lovely touch. 
The first night we had supper on the beach which was a delight. 
The food is excellent and obviously the fresh fish is a speciality. The second evening I had Sri Lankan fish curry with rice served with all its multiple vegetable curries. Absolutely delicious but filling as always . 

The pool is a good size and the area is great to relax and unwind and you can get to the beach easily and watch the sunsets. 

The staff are incredibly friendly and always want to please. I didn’t want to leave and 2 nights certainly wasn’t enough.

column12: Aditya no doubt deserves all of the high praise. Service was friendly and attentive, coupled with a range of top notch amenities to indulge in during our stay. My sister and I went for a rejuvenating dip in the ocean, returning to the breeze and bath salts of the rooftop jacuzzi in the beautiful Surya Suite. The architecture of the resort itself is fascinating, which had us exploring and admiring it in awe. Aditya holds a real charm of its own with insightful art pieces, timeless furniture and unparalleled character. The food was delicious and our room was incredibly cosy (leaving was a struggle). We will be back for sure and do thank all of the staff for creating such a wonderful holiday!

column12: I recently stayed at Aditya Boutique Resort with my wife, and we had a wonderful time. The resort is on a beautiful private beach with stunning views of the Indian Ocean. The suites are all individually designed and have private plunge pools or jacuzzis, a great way to relax after exploring. The resort also offers a variety of amenities, including a spa, restaurant, and fitness centre. We recommend Aditya Boutique Resort to anyone looking for a luxurious and relaxing getaway in Sri Lanka.
column13: Beachside Bliss & Jacuzzis: Fantastic Getaway at Aditya!

column10: Sea is a bit rough for safe swimming but you can swim with care….
column12: We stayed at this fantastic, small hotel following a two week cycling tour. The hotel is beautifully located on a long empty beach and is tucked away in beautiful grounds. The rooms are outstanding and ours had a plunge pool and courtyard garden. The Hotel pool is warm and a good size with plenty of sun bed options. What makes this hotel special though are the staff who were absolutely fantastic and attentive. But not in an intrusive manner…. The restraunt food was first class with a limited but excellent menu. Again the service here was superb with a final night meal on the beach that was just lovely. A great stay and hope to return again someday. Thank you to all the staff for making our stay so memorable…..

column12:
A gorgeous boutique hotel in Rathgama. My husband and I were celebrating our first wedding anniversary and they made it extra special. 
We stayed at the Sagara suite which had far reaching ocean views.  The room was very spacious. Highlight of the trip for us was the private plunge pool with sea view. 
The staff is very friendly and attentive. Overall, loved the stay. Will be back for sure.

column6: {'id': '1181608', 'name': 'Suite Lanka', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 257, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.120059, 'longitude': 80.115715, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d1181608-Reviews-Suite_Lanka-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://suitelanka.com', 'address': '868 Galle Rd Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '868 Galle Rd', 'street2': 'Thiranagama', 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80240'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 5, 'count2': 7, 'count3': 14, 'count4': 36, 'count5': 195}}
column10: The hotel staff will arrange airport transfers for you, so just ask. They use a reputable company and excellent drivers.
column12:
This is a little gem of a hotel! The location is beautiful - absolute beach front with the sounds of waves 24/7. You can eat right beside the beach for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The rooms are colonial style with loads of character which we love. Very clean and tidy. Comfy beds too. 
Nothing was too much trouble, the staff are so friendly and accomodating. The food is delicious and the breakfast selection perfect. Make sure you order their Sri Lankan style breakfast the night before if you want that as an option. We ended up eating here most evenings too because it was so good. 
The pool is a good size and always clean, we enjoyed cooling off a few times in it after a hot day browsing the Hikkaduwa area. 
They even have a super friendly onsite dog and although there are a few stray dogs around (typical for this part of Sri Lanka) even they are super friendly and delightful company! We wish we could have brought one in particular home with us, he was such a gentle natured boy. 
Price is very reasonable we think, you wont regret staying here. 
Just a note that the beach isn't safe for swimming, but just being right on the beach is so beautiful you wont miss the ocean dip - just use the pool instead or go for a swim at nearby Turtle Bay.
column13: A little gem in Hikkaduwa - and beach front perfection!

column10: Take care if you wish to swim in the sea out of season there are strong under currents during this period even strong swimmers are at risk.
column12:
This is one of my favourite hotels and locations to visit anywhere in the world. I enjoy Suite Lanka so much that I have now stayed here 3 times over the last 10 years……and I plan to return many more times. 

The fact that it is a small boutique hotel means that it is always quiet even when fully booked. The staff are so kind, attentive and friendly making the effort to get to know you personally. 

The facilities are just what you need to relax and soak up the amazing beach scenery. 

The restaurant Olins is incredible with fresh and tasty options made in a clean and professional environment. I would highly recommend the Sri Lankan breakfast and the Sri Lankan curries as my personal favourites, although there are multiple other tasty options. The food was so good that I would return to the hotel for meals regularly and only ate out a handful of times. 

The beach view is incredible from all the rooms.
column13: A gem of a hotel with everything you could ask for to enjoy a relaxed stay

column12:
We recently stayed 11 days at this hotel and it did not disappoint. All of the members of staff were so friendly and nothing was too much trouble. They go above and beyond to make sure you are comfortable and have everything you need. The decor of the hotel is lovely, full of character and immaculately clean.  We had a ground floor suite which was stunning. 
The restaurant offers a wide variety of dishes and all the meals that we had were excellent.
After visiting other hotels in the area we definitely felt that we had made the right choice. 
Fantastic for a relaxing holiday for all of the family! 
Thank you to everyone at Suite Lanka for helping us make fabulous memories.

column12:
Absolutely loved this hotel!

Just finished a whistle stop tour of Sri Lanka.  9 hotels in 14 days ranging from small boutiques to large complexes and this was arguably my favorite of the lot!

We stayed in the Pool room which as the name suggests had access to both the pool and the beach. Plenty of room for 2 teens and 2 adults and very tastefully furnished.

A wonderful Sri Lankan breakfast (easily the best breakfast of my trip). Nice bar area and pool also which the kids enjoyed.

However,  its the staff that really make this venue. Friendly, cheerful, helpful. They are everything the hospitality trade should be.

This is a little gem of a hotel!
column13: One night stay at Suite Lanka

column12: This is a boutique hotel with some large rooms.  We had the pool suite room which had a seperate lounge room then the bedroom had a four post bed with netting and the decore was quite funky almost a tuscany feel to it.  Being a small hotel there was only our group and another two couples for dinner so there was a bit of rearranging for the dinner table for our group.  The meal we had was the best meal we had in our time in Sri Lanka.  We called out the Chefs and gave them the biggest praising clap and hooray for their efforts.   The rooms were clean and large with a view of the beach which at the time had crashing waves and lots of rain.  It was great to fall asleep to.  The bed was really comfortable.  Another beach venue we would revisit.
column13: Suite Lanka should be named Sweet Lanka - really lovely.

column12:
This place is amazing, but it would be nothing without the staff who really made our stay special. Nothing is too much trouble for them, they are both friendly, helpful and hard working, always on hand to help with any little thing, even if it is just local travel advice. The deputy manager Kumarasiri was especially friendly and made sure our every need was met.
The room was huge an easily accomodated the four of us, we had the pool suite which opened on both sides, to the pool and also the beachfront garden, where you can dine, use the sunbeds or just relax on a sofa and read, that's if you don't want to sit on your large balcony.
The beds were very comfortable and the 4-poster in the main room was huge. everything was provided in the bathroom, loads of towels, shampoo, conditioner, soap, shower gel.
The restaurant and dining were fabulous, breakfast has a range of options from traditional Sri Lankan breakfast with sambal and rice to continential or cooked, loads of fresh fruit and juice, and of course tea, it wouldn't be Sri Lanka without Ceylon tea. Evening meals were fabulous, we ate there most nights, very reasonable pricing for such tasty and feshly cooked food, i particularly enjoyed the black pork curry and my kids loved the fried noodles and fried rice.
Our kids loved the pool area, it's secluded and sheltered, right next to the rooms and the pool bar.
The hotel itself is secured at night and has a permanent security guard once the staff go home, the guard is a lovely fellow, constantly patrolling and keeping an eye out which is very reassurring. 
One day we had to leave to go to the temple at a very early hour of 5am, so the hotel prepared us packed breakfasts (which they didn't have to do) and the security guard made sure we had them ready for when we left.
I cannot reccomend this place more highly, out of the 5 places we stayed in Sri Lanka, from east to west coast, this was the highlight and the best accomodation experience, it way exceeeded my expectations, especially given the very cheap price, i would not have expected somewhere so good at such a low price per night for 4 people.
column13: An amazing colonial-style boutique hotel with fabulous staff and facilities

column5: {'id': '965819658', 'text': "We are thrilled that we met your hopes for a rewarding relaxation after your mighty cycle ride around the island. Your comments about our restaurant are really appreciated and I'm sure that Kumarasiri will be uplifted that you found his service so thoughtful. All in all, your review has given us a lot to smile about - if you visit again get in touch with us and we'll do our best to sort out that Penthouse Suite for you!\nBest regards\nThe Suite Lanka team", 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-08-20', 'responder': 'David Hopps', 'connectionToSubject': 'General Manager'}
column6: {'id': '1181608', 'name': 'Suite Lanka', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 257, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.120059, 'longitude': 80.115715, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d1181608-Reviews-Suite_Lanka-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://suitelanka.com', 'address': '868 Galle Rd Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '868 Galle Rd', 'street2': 'Thiranagama', 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80240'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 5, 'count2': 7, 'count3': 14, 'count4': 36, 'count5': 195}}
column12:
Recently back from wonderful 5 night stay at this lovely hotel after cycling around the island.

The hotel is immaculate which is a credit to all the staff who work to ensure our stay was perfect not just from cleaning the room daily but those cheerful staff who keep the grounds so clean everyday.

The breakfast options are perfect, I would highly recommend the homemade muesli, it was delicious.  We opted to try the evening meals, this was absolutely superb, the quality and taste of the food was incredible, and was beautifully presented that we decided to eat at the restaurant every evening throughout our stay.

A special shout out to Kumarisir (I think that’s how you spell it) he was so welcoming on our arrival, ensured everything was perfect,  and always remembered what we had to drink.

We would definitely return to Suite Lanka and hopefully have the opportunity to stay in the Penthouse Suite.

column5: {'id': '964744652', 'text': 'Your review has blown us away! Thank-you so much for those kind words. The staff will be really encouraged to read it, especially Siri. Those banana and chocolate pancakes are a recent addition and proving to be very popular!\nBest regards\nThe Suite Lanka team', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-08-14', 'responder': 'David Hopps', 'connectionToSubject': 'General Manager'}
column6: {'id': '1181608', 'name': 'Suite Lanka', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 257, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.120059, 'longitude': 80.115715, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d1181608-Reviews-Suite_Lanka-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://suitelanka.com', 'address': '868 Galle Rd Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '868 Galle Rd', 'street2': 'Thiranagama', 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80240'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 5, 'count2': 7, 'count3': 14, 'count4': 36, 'count5': 195}}
column12:
Wow! What a wonderful time we had at this superb little hotel! From the moment we landed to the moment we left, we were made to feel so welcome and comfortable! It was almost as we were staying in a house with family members!!
When we arrived we were given a deliciously cold fruit drink and a wet cloth to refresh from Siri and his excellent team! Our room was beautiful, clean and huge with spectacular sea views!
Excellent shower and plenty of hot water!
The restaurant, sunloungers and the sea were just down the stairs, approx 20m away from us - it was just like paradise!
Breakfast was excellent - and in particular the banana and chocolate sauce pancakes - delicious!! Food was excellent - rice and curry, devilled chicken and the kebab - we hardly got through the vast menu during our 4 day stay! Our 5:30 cocktails made by Siri - a different one every day, was a lovely aperitif before dinner!
Excellent clean pool too!!
I would like to thank Siri in particular who looked after us so well! His English is excellent and he is so kind, intelligent and friendly- as were all the staff!
Thank you Suite Lanka - we will never forget you!! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!

column5: {'id': '964744867', 'text': 'Many thanks for taking the trouble to review Suite Lanka. We are pleased that you had such a happy and relaxing time with us and met up with some old friends. column10: Stay at least for 2 nights.
column12:
I stayed at Suite Lanka with friends for a quick getaway from Colombo, and it exceeded our expectations. Despite being off-season, with many cafes and restaurants closed, the location was perfect. The beautiful beach was ideal for walks, and the area was pleasantly quiet.

We stayed on the top floor with a direct sea view. The room was massive, very comfortable beds, with writing table and sofa and it was like having our own apartment, complete with a big bathroom with a tub and a spacious common area. The Sri Lankan breakfast was fantastic, especially the dara poranu paang, a rare treat on the island. The club sandwich we had was delicious too.

The staff were extremely friendly and always ready to take pictures for us. We were allowed to check in early with no extra charge, which was great. The pool area was lovely and very photogenic. Our only regret was staying just one night; we wished we could have stayed at least two.

column5: {'id': '962504597', 'text': 'Thank-you for your affection for Suite Lanka and your kind words about Kumara. The manager does not cook very much these days, but he will be able to show our chefs your comment! We will always try to make Suite Lanka a home from home for our guests and we are pleased that you had such a happy stay with us.\nBest regards\nThe Suite lanka team', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-07-31', 'responder': 'David Hopps', 'connectionToSubject': 'General Manager'}

column12:
I have been twice, would definitely come back again. Mr. Kumara is the best owner. Even once served personalised dinner for me and my friends. Hotel feels like at home, food amazing, best location, always clean. 
I highly recommended staying with them. 
Best wishes from Inna, Kazakhstan

column12: This is a small well run hotel with 9 rooms only, 2-3 km from Turtle beach and Hikkaduwa town, right on the beach. We stayed there four nights (22-26 July) and booked two rooms. The hotel was clean, quite and the extremely friendly and helpful staff, especially the assistant manager Kumarasri. They do not have breakfast buffet but they made both Sri Lankan and continental breakfast for us. They also arranged a driver/guide for visiting Weligama/Mirissa and to the airport. Highly recommend this place

column5: {'id': '948249911', 'text': "It sounds as if you really enjoyed your time at Suite Lanka - and that will put a smile on everybody's when we pass on the news. column10: Don't hesitate, you won't regret booking here.
column12:
We LOVED our time at Suit Lanka. From start to finish, we cannot fault a thing. The staff are fabulous and cannot do enough; the rooms are gorgeous -large, tastefully furnished and with excellent air conditioning; location is perfect at quieter end of beach; pool is lovely; bar is first rate and happy hour a bonus!
Hage to mention the fact that while check out is midday, we were able to use one of our rooms as a base to shower, charge phones etc until our airport pick up at 7pm. At no charge.
We would highly recommend staying at Suite Lanka.

The room wqs cozy and clean,with a historic Srilankan touch. 

The staff team were very helpful,good hospitality.

The food was excellent,fresh and tasty. Breakfast with the view was my fav. moment.

Outdoor space,thr garden,pool area are postcard perfect.

column10: First floor rooms are recommended as they have the best views of the beach and sea.
column12:
My wife and I finished our 18 day holiday around Sri Lanka with 3 days at Suite Lanka- we couldn’t be happier. This little hotel is directly on the beach. We were lucky to have the room called Polonnaruwa on the first floor which has amazing views over the private garden and outdoor dining area to the smooth sandy beach and turquoise sea. The room was extremely spacious with a huge four-poster bed and colonial style furniture. In fact I would say that out of all the hotels we have stayed in, this was the most sumptuous. The room also had a huge private balcony with a massive and comfortable day bed. Ideal to enjoy watching the sun-setting with cold glass of Lion Lager or a gin and tonic from the bar. Breakfasts are amazing and we had the choice of a Sr Lankan breakfast , English Breakfast or Continental Breakfast. I can recommend both the English and Sri Lankan- freshly cooked and delicious. We also ate in the evening twice and thoroughly enjoyed the food which is always freshly prepared which means you might have to wait a little. 
You could tell that all the well trained staff enjoyed working at Suite Lanka- always smiling and happy to help with anything. The outside dining area looks onto the beach and there are a few comfortable sun-beds in the garden facing the sea and a few on the beach itself with parasols providing shade. We had a throughly relaxing stay at Suite Lanka and whilst it is at the quieter end of the beach- the noisier beach bars and restaurants are only  10 minute stroll on the beach. The hotel does have a small courtyard pool which we didn’t use as we spent our time on the sunbeds or paddling in the crashing waves. 
I highly recommend staying here. We couldn’t have wished for a better hotel to spend our last three days in Sri Lanka.

column5: {'id': '937610861', 'text': 'We are really grateful that you have taken the time to review us on Tripadvisor. column12:
We stayed in the Heritage suite which is massive. We loved being on the ground floor as the space is still private and we could go in and out easily to access the beach.
The hotel provides yoga mats. Just a short beach walk to the busy side of Hikkaduwa, the location is ideal for a quiet stay. We found the food and cocktails really nice too. Order the Sri Lankan breakfast at least one morning… Delish!
column13: Perfect location for a nice and quiet stay in Hikkiduwa

column5: {'id': '937419126', 'text': 'Thank-you for your thoughtful and generous review. Our staff really enjoyed hosting you at Suite Lanka and you both really added to the positive and easy-going vibe of the place. As you know, we have all the sports channels in the rooms as well, but watching a match while the other person is asleep does create a few problems with the noise levels so we were pleased to open up the TV lounge! It is just a shame that the result did not go the way you wanted. We know that you stayed at some wonderful places on your tour so the staff are proud that you enjoyed Suite Lanka. Travel well in the future.\nBest regards\nThe Suite Lanka team', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-02-08', 'responder': 'David Hopps', 'connectionToSubject': 'General Manager'}
column6: {'id': '1181608', 'name': 'Suite Lanka', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 257, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.120059, 'longitude': 80.115715, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d1181608-Reviews-Suite_Lanka-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://suitelanka.com', 'address': '868 Galle Rd Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '868 Galle Rd', 'street2': 'Thiranagama', 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80240'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 5, 'count2': 7, 'count3': 14, 'count4': 36, 'count5': 195}}
column12: We stayed here as part of a 3 week tour around Sri Lanka which included several hotels, and Suite Lanka was a real stand out.  The location is great, with both Galle & Colombo in easy reach.  The position, with the beach just a few steps away from the rooms across the hotel’s private garden, means you can easily wander along the beach to choose where to eat.  But that’s not really necessary as the food at Suite Lanka is delicious - fantastic fresh seafood and local dishes as you’d expect, but also more than enough options to satisfy different tastes.  Our room was fab - large and airy, comfortably furnished, with the perfect view across the beach to the sea from the huge private balcony.  And the staff did a great job of making sure we had a great time - from tweaking menu options to suit our individual tastes, to opening the TV room at 1:45am so I could watch a football match. They strike exactly the right balance between being there to help whenever needed and not being intrusive.  After a busy couple of weeks exploring this lovely country, Suite Lanka was the perfect place to recharge, enjoying great food and service, and soaking up the very relaxed and luxurious feel.
column13: Whether you’re recharging the batteries between stops or seeking an idyllic beach holiday, Suite Lanka is a gem.

column5: {'id': '937411534', 'text': 'We are really happy that you enjoyed Suite Lanka. In particular, we have been trying hard to make our courtyard pool as good as it can be so the fact you really liked it brings us great pleasure. We really value Tripadvisor reviews so thank-you for taking the time to do this.\nBest regards\nThe Suite Lanka team', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-02-07', 'responder': 'David Hopps', 'connectionToSubject': 'General Manager'}

column12:
Had a lovely relaxing 3 days here as the last stop on our Sri Lanka tour. We were given a ground floor suite overlooking the ocean with a shady veranda to enjoy the view. Nice quiet hotel at the South end of the beach but only 15 minutes along the beach or a short tuktuk ride to town, even though there is really no need to go to town as there are plenty restaurants and a better beach in the vicinity.
We really liked the courtyard pool which was clean and cool. 
Breakfast was excellent, with a choice of Sri Lankan, English or continental. Everything was delicious and freshly prepared, so don't be in a rush!
We also enjoyed some Happy Hour cocktails sitting watching the sun go down over the ocean, heaven. 
Staff were friendly and everything is clean. Highly recommended.
column13: Lovely small hotel in the perfect location

column10: Staff are so helpful. Easy to walk & catch local bus so it is worth being out in this lovely area near the lake, with a pool & restaurant.
column12: Charming secluded little place surrounded by lush gardens with lovely pool area, friendly helpful staff and great food.  Just a short walk/bus to town so definitely worth being out near the lake and the tranquility.   Very comfy rooms with lake outlook & bar fridge.
column13: Peaceful escape, a world away from the town

column12: What an amazing experience!! First time to Sri Lanka and it won't be the last. Asian Jewel was so relaxing and had a great stay and will return again. The food was first class especially the Sri Lankan Curry and the Sunday roast. The rooms were really clean and well appointed. Dale and his staff fantastic and very friendly and helpful. Can't wait to return!!
column13: An Amazing Experience - Can't wait to return!!

column6: {'id': '1009523', 'name': 'Asian Jewel Boutique Hotel', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 537, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.137165, 'longitude': 80.11285, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d1009523-Reviews-Asian_Jewel_Boutique_Hotel-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/p/Asian-Jewel-Hotel-Sri-Lanka-100063642308586/', 'address': 'Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80240'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 0, 'count2': 4, 'count3': 5, 'count4': 35, 'count5': 493}}
column12: This was our second stay at Asian Jewel and it was every bit as enjoyable as the first. Our room (Jasmine) had a direct panoramic view of Bird Lake and we saw many different species of birds as well as small animals including chipmunks, water monitors, geckos (and a cobra one one day but soon banished by the staff...). The staff here are wonderful, friendly and welcoming and nothing too much trouble, and the food is excellent with both Sri Lankan and British options. We are vegetarians and they went out of their way to adapt meals pretty much to whatever suits, but the star of the show is the Sri Lankan rice and curry. It is in a peaceful location but only a short and cheap tuk tuk ride - around £1.75 - into the more hectic beach area.We would strongly recommend.
column13: Lovely hotel, wonderful staff, excellent food, lots of birds/wildlife

column6: {'id': '1009523', 'name': 'Asian Jewel Boutique Hotel', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 537, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.137165, 'longitude': 80.11285, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d1009523-Reviews-Asian_Jewel_Boutique_Hotel-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/p/Asian-Jewel-Hotel-Sri-Lanka-100063642308586/', 'address': 'Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Lane 3, Field View, Baddegama Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80240'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 0, 'count2': 4, 'count3': 5, 'count4': 35, 'count5': 493}}
column12:
The rooms are a little tired and dated, but the whole experience of this hidden gem is fantastic. By far, the best food served in Hikkaduwa..... The only place to experience the Authentic Local Curry!!!! Amazing. Dale and his staff are absolutely great, Overlooks a lovely lake, while only a short tuk tuk away from the main beach area.
This is a must visit, also welcomes guests for lunch or Dinner. you wont be disappointed!

column10: Check out the traditional English Sunday Roast....yum yum...
column12:
Amazing Hotel...a 2 minute tut tut ride from the main drag...Beautiful swimming pool overlooking a lovely Lagoon...My room was spotless with Amazing views...The Food is Amazing... English @ Sri Lankan food the best we had in Hikkaduwa....Lastly the Manager Dale a English guy and the other staff couldn't do enough for you...We will definitely be coming back next year...
Superb place....
column13: A little Gem of a find....

column12: Although the rooms are a little dated, they are clean and spacious  with a lovely large terrace in a lovely location overlooking a beautiful lake. We really enjoyed the view whilst having our morning coffee and saw various birds and parrots. The rooms are actually above a restaurant and just 7 minutes from town via tuk tuk. So if you are looking for character with a lovely chilled garden pool area look no further! All the staff are so friendly and the food is beyond delicious- as well as having a lovely breakfast here each morning, we enjoyed a fresh tuna salad and their amazing Sri Lankan curry. We enjoyed our stay here!

column12: I had an amazing stay at Hikkaduwa Residence. The host, Chamara, was exceptional—friendly, attentive, and always available to offer helpful advice. The location was perfect, just a short walk to the beach and a tuk tuk away from some nice places to eat. The guesthouse itself was spotless, with clean and comfortable rooms. The breakfast each morning was delicious and fresh. I also appreciated the airport pick-up and drop-off service, which was very reasonably priced and made my trip much smoother. Highly recommend this place for a relaxing stay in Hikkaduwa!

column6: {'id': '8669735', 'name': 'The Residence Hikkaduwa', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 353, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.139847, 'longitude': 80.10202, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d8669735-Reviews-The_Residence_Hikkaduwa-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.theresidencehikkaduwa.com', 'address': '24B Amarasena Mw, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '24B Amarasena Mw', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80240'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 0, 'count2': 0, 'count3': 0, 'count4': 4, 'count5': 349}}
column10: Residence Hikkaduwa,Best value for stay in Sri Lanka 👍
column12: The rooms at The Residence Hikkaduwa offer a luxurious and relaxing experience. Each room is spacious and tastefully decorated with modern furnishings. Guests can enjoy a private plunge pool, air-conditioning, and complimentary Wi-Fi. The rooms also feature king-size beds with premium linens, flat-screen TVs, en-suite bathrooms with rain showers, and complimentary toiletries. In addition, there is a mini-bar, a safe, and tea/coffee-making facilities, ensuring all your needs are met for a comfortable stay. From Hong Kong 🇭🇰
column13: Chamara and the staff is awesome

column12: The Residence Hikkaduwa offers an exceptional experience with its luxurious and well-appointed rooms. Each room is equipped with modern amenities, including comfortable beds, air conditioning, flat-screen TVs, and complimentary Wi-Fi. Some rooms feature private plunge pools, perfect for a relaxing dip. The spacious bathrooms come with premium toiletries and rain showers, ensuring a comfortable stay. column6: {'id': '8669735', 'name': 'The Residence Hikkaduwa', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 353, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.139847, 'longitude': 80.10202, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d8669735-Reviews-The_Residence_Hikkaduwa-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.theresidencehikkaduwa.com', 'address': '24B Amarasena Mw, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '24B Amarasena Mw', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80240'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 0, 'count2': 0, 'count3': 0, 'count4': 4, 'count5': 349}}
column10: Please contact Chamara, he will arrange all you need for a good relaxation
column12:
From the moment we arrived, we were warmly welcomed by the lovely owner, Chamara, and the staff. They couldn't do enough for us, making us feel right at home. Our room, number one, was of a five-star standard—beautifully and tastefully decorated, spotlessly clean, and equipped with everything needed for a luxurious stay. The beds were extremely comfortable, ensuring a restful night.
Breakfast was a highlight, freshly prepared by the host and their team. We had the choice between Sri Lankan and international options, both generous in portion and delicious.
The pool was lovely, the lounge areas very comfortable, and the rooftop offered a serene sea view. The property is quiet and well-secured, and the staff were always ready to assist with rides, exercise, activities, and local dining recommendations in Hikkaduwa.
Highly recommend this property—it was the best place we stayed during our visit to Sri Lanka. We'll certainly be returning soon. Thank you for an unforgettable stay!

column6: {'id': '8669735', 'name': 'The Residence Hikkaduwa', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 353, 'locationString': 'Hikkaduwa, Galle District, Southern Province', 'latitude': 6.139847, 'longitude': 80.10202, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304134-d8669735-Reviews-The_Residence_Hikkaduwa-Hikkaduwa_Galle_District_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.theresidencehikkaduwa.com', 'address': '24B Amarasena Mw, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '24B Amarasena Mw', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Hikkaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '80240'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 0, 'count2': 0, 'count3': 0, 'count4': 4, 'count5': 349}}
column12:
Couldn’t recommend this place enough!! 10/10 experience from the minute we booked, Chamara the host and his family were so accommodating to me and my friends. We booked both rooms of the villa and both were immaculately clean, so spacious and had everything we needed and more! From complimentary snacks to robes and toiletries. The breakfast was an amazing three course meal with a fruit platter, variety of Sri Lankan food and dessert. Chamara was so attentive to detail that he even switched out the fruits we didn’t eat on the first morning, to fruits that we liked for the breakfast on the second day. 
The place was very serene and we felt so safe as a group of girls. 
If you’re coming to Hikkaduwa, the residence is a MUST STAY!!

column12: We had a great stay, would highly recommend! The accommodation was stunning, really close to the beach and a lovely breakfast each morning. When we arrived we were greeted with a warm welcome and refreshing welcome drink, setting the tone for a wonderful stay. Our room was spotlessly clean, spacious and elegantly decorated. A great combination of luxury, comfort, and excellent service which made our stay really memorable.
